description:
4 stars for food and 3 stars for service, so rounding up to a 4. This isn't the best place for Japanese food, but it's not the worst either. 

Pros: Huge selection of food - sushi rolls, bento boxes, ramen, udon, and curry. They have lunch specials everyday from 11am-4pm, and the prices are reasonable for the portion. They also offer parking validation ($2 off) for Japan Center Garage.  

I ordered the katsu curry, and the amount of rice and curry was more than I expected. I could barely finish half of the bowl, so I would recommend sharing unless you're feeling very hungry. The curry was flavorful and not spicy at all, and the pork cutlet was average. The rest of my group ordered the bento box and sushi rolls and said they were pretty good, but the portions in the bento box were a bit smaller compared to other places I've been to. 

Cons: Restaurant is small with few tables. There was a bit of a wait even though there was only one party ahead of us. The prices shown on the menu board outside were also not updated I think. The menu board listed the katsu curry as $12.95, but the menu they gave at the table listed it as $13.95. $1 difference isn't a huge issue, but it was a bit misleading.
author: Christine V.

description:
I immediately noticed that the tempura crumbles on my Mango Crunch roll were not crunchy. They were soggy. I mentioned this to one of the servers and she said they were not supposed to be soggy and that she'd take care of it.
When she returned, she reassured me that the crumbles were made today. Additionally, she had sprinkled even more crumbles over the roll for me. Thanks... ?
On my second attempt to eat this roll, I encountered a large oily clump of crumbles, bleckh!!! The roll itself was ok, so I put in some elbow grease, and dusted off the crumbles from each piece. My dinner buddy suggested I use the pickled ginger pieces to wipe off the soggy bits, like a car wash, bahahaha!!!

We also ordered a Screaming Orgasm roll. The shrimp tempura in the center of the roll was, yet again, SOGGY.

The Hamchi Lover roll was good. Their sushi rice was acceptable. Boat loads of soggy tempura is NOT acceptable! No reason to go back there again. There are soooo many other better Japanese restaurants in SF!
author: Sharon W.

description:
Cute little place but the food is merely serviceable.  I got a bowl of the Miso ramen and while it was ok, it definitely wasn't great. My friend got the veggie tempura and it similarly was just ok.

Prices are decent, an ok place to eat if you are in this shopping center.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place. 
Mom & I had lunch here while visiting Japantown SF. 
The restaurant is located in the row of restaurants inside. 
We ordered two lunch sets, one sashimi set & one teriyaki sake (salmon) set. If I recall correctly, the lunch sets were choice of two different fish options so for our second option we got calamari & saba. Since my mom & I share everything we got to taste a variety & everything was on point. 
Both had good quality fish & the portion size was just right for two small Asians such as ourselves haha. Perfect with a Sapporo. 
Staff was very friendly & we had a lovely lunch.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Kushi Tsuru was excellent. I came in time for their lunch special and got the bento box with beef teriyaki & salmon sashimi. It came with miso soup, salad and orange slices. I came during the time of the cherry blossom festival and the line was really really long but fortunately we made reservations the day before as we were celebrating my cousins birthday. My only complaint is that we had made a reservation at 2 but didn't get seated until around 2:45. And that the place was kinda small, including their bathroom where there was barely room to turnaround. 
Other than that, the service was great, the food was great and the price was great. We brought a cake for my cousins birthday and the servers actually turned the lights off in the restaurant as they were bringing it out while singing. Such a fun place!!
author: Catherine H.

description:
First time in Japantown with an hour until closing. Hungry after trekking through bustling Union Square. It was either this or the full place next door with a shocking 2 star average rating. Kushi Tsuru it is! Rock those 3 stars proudly, Kushi. It was difficult to find a place with both ramen and usual rice/sashimi dishes to please everyone. 8pm on Saturday and a family of 4 waited ahead of us, not too long before we sat. No point in writing my name on the list because they called me after we were already seated. I noticed they still accept customers with only 20 min left to spare. It appears they don't kick anyone out, very nice. 

Our waitress was efficient and super busy taking care of all the tables in our area. She did a quick check if everything was a-ok once food arrived. My fam and I ordered 2 item dinner Bentos, pricier than the usual Japanese establishment, but it's SF. Decent quality. I got chicken teriyaki and gyoza, comes with soup, salad, rice, and 2 CA roll pieces. Good kind of imitation crab meat mixed with mayo, none of that merely sliced fake crab stuffed into a roll. Miso soup was salty, probably from the bottom of the warmer at the end of the night. Spider-Man 1 roll was basic with 5 pieces and crisp soft shell crab. Satisfies the craving. Sashimi quality is ok. My sister's tonkatsu ramen was good! Broth wasn't too salty. Noodles were softer.

Restroom situation is funny. When you gotta go and the two individual rooms are empty, no one notices nor cares about the men or women sign on the door. When in SF ... just to be clear, the first door says men, second one women. 

Solid spot for no frills Japanese food. Check out the udon or ramen places for soup. Next time I want to try out Izakaya KOU across the street near Boba Guys for skewers and a more urban experience, but gotta make a reservation.
author: Kristine F.

description:
We stopped by Kushi Tsuru for dinner and initially were skeptical because there was only one other customer inside. However, we decided to give it a try because of the menu and inviting decor.

We ordered hot green tea and two bento boxes with short ribs, salmon, shrimp tempura, and chicken. The bento boxes came with miso soup that was unfortunately too salty so it had to be sent back and replaced with something more diluted.

The bento boxes themselves though were not bad and our favorite was the shrimp tempura.

Overall, it was a mostly good experience as the waitress was attentive and we enjoyed most of the food
author: Minh N.

description:
I've tried most of the restaurants in Japan Town, but this is one that has seemed to have missed me somehow.  Well, thanks to Benihana's being completely booked, we decided to give this place a chance. 

Service was fine, but took awhile to be greeted, which was something that was slightly annoying.  Still, staff was friendly overall.  The food, was a bit on the lacking side.  Karaage chicken was really good, but everything else need a bit more on the flavor side.  Still prices were fair enough. 

There are a ton of places in Japan Town worth trying, and I wouldn't say this is the worst, but it's easily not one of the best.  Still, it was OK in my book at the end of the day.
author: Benny H.

description:
How dare they claim to be the best Japanese restaurant in Japanese Town?! Farce! Lies!

The good:
+they open early @ 11am
+staff is nice
+they get busy quick (probably because of open time)
+OK for a quick meal.
+ pork ok

The bad:
- smelled heavily of cleaning solvents when we walked in @ 11
- used hard boiled egg in my ramen! F U
- ramen too salty.
- didn't bring out my ramen fast enough so the seaweed was all melted into the broth.

Overall an OK place to eat, but if you have the extra time wait 30 minutes more for better options to open up. Like my friend said, it's only good ramen if you've never had ramen.
author: Minh S.

description:
Went to find something to eat after exploring around Japantown and it was okay. The amount of food for the price was okay, but the wait staff was terrible. 

We got seated at a table and the workers took so long to come and take our order. Within the time we were waiting, my boyfriend went to the bathroom and came back, sat at least three other parties near us and still didn't bring us water or take our order. At one point the girl almost went to take orders from a table that got seated after us but fortunately she didn't because I made eye contact with her. After we ordered and got our food, they didn't come back to our table once. The other waitress later came and gave our bill without saying thank you or anything.

It would've been more enjoyable to eat here if the workers were more attentive to the customers, but unfortunately that wasn't the case. I hope the workers change and make the customers feel more valued that they're giving service to their restaurant.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Location is easy since it's inside the shopping mall in Japantown and no wait to get a table during dinner time on a Friday. 

The waitress and others were friendly but there was no organization. We got our miso soup twice by two different waitresses. The first put them down and quickly cleaned them up when we finished and a second waitress came by and dropped them off again. We told her and she let us keep them anyway.

We ordered lots of food and I was not very impressed with anything. I got the combo entree which was a pretty good price for the amount of food. Comes with soup, white rice, and salad. I got my three choices - shrimp tempura, BBQ short rib, and Saba shioyaki. I didn't like the tempura batter, the BBQ short rib was good but hard to eat with just my chopsticks and large pieces of it - a bit chewy, and the Saba was good. The salad was extremely disappointing. The lettuce tasted old and I expected ginger or peanut dressing since I was at a Japanese restaurant and I'm not sure what the dressing was but I wish I was given the options. 

We had steamed Gyoza which was just okay and I tried the Tomago which also was not great. 

I'm disappointed that we chose this place out of convenience since I was only in town that one night.
author: Mai L.

description:
This is perfect place for you if u r on a diet.
Because they will lose your appetite by their dirtiness.. 
I think they have so much advantage of location. It's in the Japanese plaza, restaurant row. People will just drop by with no doubt. So easy to draw people here. That's why they don't try harder at all. Been there 2 times and their food is below average. But even before the food, the environment lose my appetite already.
author: JS P.

description: I am very disappointed with this restaurant. I went for lunch and ordered a dragon roll, beef don, and bento box for lunch. Nothing had flavor. The tempura in the dragon roll tasted old and not crunchy. The eel had no flavor at all. The beef don came with small and super dry pieces of beef. I could barely eat it. My friend who ordered the teriyaki beef and pork katsu had thin slices for what she paid and the flavor was bland. What made the whole experience worse is that we saw a cockroach roaming near us in the wall. We brought it up to the worker and they acted like no big deal. We were disgusted and couldn't finish our food. They charged us for the full meal. I WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN.
author: Brenda M.

description: Decent sushi and it wasn't too expensive. They have a salmon lover roll which was pretty good but some pieces had too much avocado on it. Salmon didn't taste the freshest but it was decent. Lobster roll was a bit too fried for me. Small place inside one of the malls of Japantown.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
I would probably only return if I was in Japan town with friends and wanted a simple dinner that was convenient. The quality isn't something I would go out of my way for. 

Average priced rolls. ~$15 for a bento. I never get Bentos but that seems expensive for only two California rolls, salad, and a second entree.
author: Danae L.

description:
Good enough in general, and mostly, affordable. However, i wont go again because there is much better japanese food in the malls and the area.
We had a curry bowl, which was very big and good enough, and 2 bento boxes. The one with beef teriyaki, the sauce and flavor are good, but you can tell the beef is not that great. The salmon teriyaki I didnt get to try it, but my friend said something similar, that it was good but not extraordinary.
I do have to say they have lunch specials even on weekends, so it was affordable at least.
author: Mimi Y.

description: This place is one of the best restaurants in Japantown and I definitely recommend this place. The food was delicious and tasty. The server was polite and fast. I love this place!!!
author: Batzorig O.

description:
Stopped here after having difficulties finding a decent food place for a large group (greater than 10) with dietary restrictions. 

We just missed out on the lunch deals but dinner wasn't too expensive. I ordered a bento with salmon teriyaki and sashimi. The bento came with two California rolls, salad, miso soup, and rice. The portions were reasonable but not large. The California rolls were ok, and the sashimi was decent, but the salmon was a bit overcooked and nothing special. 

Overall, the meal was fine but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to go back, and if I find myself here again, I'll probably stick to the sashimi which was decent/good.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Food is really good! But the service is even better! Even when it's busy, staff is very attentive and kind. I always come here before work for some agedashi tofu 10/10 recommend!
author: Christina T.

description:
Came here on a tuesday on my day off which was two days ago!!! I wanted to try out another Japanese Restaurant at Japantown and that would be Kushi Tsuri!!! When I got here it wasn't that busy yet when coming here for lunch... The hostess took me right away to my table which  was really fast without waiting its because it was only me that was here!!!

As I got seated and this what I wanted to order from the of Kushi Tsuri and what I ordered for myself was a Coca Cola, 8 Piece California Roll & Pork Katsu Donburi... And my wait for my food didn't take that long my waitress who took my order came to me with my food order which came really fast to without waiting that long!!! 

After finishing up my 8 Piece California Roll & Pork Katsu Donburi and I have to say that my 8 Piece California Sushi Roll came out really good and I really liked it!!! And as for the Pork Katsu Donburi it came out really hot so hot that I had to be careful not to burn my tongue I managed to finish the Pork Katsu Donburi with burning my tongue and I have to say that tasted really good as well!!! And this was my very 1st time eating lunch at Kushi Tsuru I would definitely would wanna go back to Kushi Tsuru and try another thing to eat for lunch at Kushi Tsuri!!!
author: William B.

description:
Ah came in with a lot of expectations because, after all, we are in Japantown...so the food must be good? They advertised the place really well with the 3-D models of the food in the front and all...Even the inside deco was thematically relevant and tasteful. The service was okay-nothing spectacular/terrible.

But the food...I was pleasantly surprised that it was $13.50 for a dinner bento. I ordered the shrimp tempura+sashimi bento box (they let you choose TWO items). BUT the miso soup was pretty salty. The rice was overcooked. 

The shrimp tempura was good (crispy enough)+the sashimi was a bit on the slimy side/not as fresh as it could have been. The salad was alright (nothing special-just lettuce with bits of purple cabbage, shredded carrots, and dressing). 

In comparison, the Japanese restaurants in Cupertino/Saratoga (at least in terms of their bentos) are much better:(
author: Christine H.

description: Food was ok. Quality of the shrimp felt it was borderline going bad. I went for their bento box. Maybe opt for the ramen instead.
author: Anthony L.

description: Unexceptional food, service, and atmosphere. We were starving and everything else was closed or only ramen.
author: Tanya W.

description: Clarks are friendly. Even though my group were 16, she organized all tables well. I appreciate it. I ordered Katsu curry and the amount of food was good enough to be full. Actually, it was too much for me. However, "Katsu curry" isn't delicious than I expected even though this is placed on the popular menu. I regret ordering this food a little bit.
author: Wayne S.

description:
I hate to give it one star but I must... 

Our waitress was super nice but super spacey . She never gave us our sodas we ordered and after our meal came out she never came back . We had to go to the front to ask to check out . 

The misio soup was amazing ! It was more on the salty side ( which I personally prefer ). 

The ramen was the worst I've ever had . I can't really say one good thing about it.... small portion , zero flavor just all around NO. 

The sushi was the only saving thing here keeping it at 1 star and not 0 . I had the screaming orgasm. The portion was decent and had some good flavor.

I feel bad giving this review because the waitress had such a cute and lovely demeanor .
author: Megan C.

description:
Had a pretty good experience here! Rushing to find a place to eat in Japantown before going to the Color Factory (YAY) and the entire mall was PACKED on a Sunday afternoon. Worried about getting there in time and not as much as I usually would about food I stumbled upon this place with no line (thank god). Small store, bathroom inside (the women's bathroom is so crowded out in the mall)!!!

Service was pretty fast, and food came out fast. I got the salmon teriyaki and the bbq ribs bento box for the lunch special. The salmon was quite dry but the ribs were good. Not bad. My boyfriend got the chicken egg donburi and I've never had donburi before and I thought it was amazing!! It's simple (chicken, steamed egg, and rice) but it was so good in my opinion!!! I don't usually like egg (esp the yolk) but this steamed egg was so flavorful and seasoned that I couldn't taste the yolky flavor that I don't like. Delish!

We finished quickly and got out of there in no time. Not an amazing restaurant, but giving it high ratings because it's not a bad place to eat at esp when you don't have to be picky (i usually would never choose to eat at a 3 star restaurant)!
author: Catherine Q.

description: My sister thought it was okay but I didn't. I wish I looked on Yelp before I came here. Unauthentic Japanese food. DON'T get the RAMEN! This is probably the worse Ramen that I have ever had. The broth was okay but the egg was disappointing wasn't soaked in the sauce that other Ramen places do. My sister got the Lion King roll and it wasn't all that good either ( it was okay) The service was great but the food was so disappointing.
author: Monica L.

description:
15 years ago, I started college in SF, and Japantown was within distance, so it became my go to spot for food. From dates, to meals with friends, it houses so many memories for me.

Kushi Tsuru was one of the first restaurants I tried in this plaza. It's the one I'll head to first before the other ones. Even now, 15 years later, it's still my go to spot.

I remember the older gentleman who always greeted us. The nice waitresses who never gave me any attitude, and the delicious foods. I don't think they have this anymore, but there was an SF special with oyster, shrimp, and fish.

It's a smaller restaurant and I enjoy the cozy feel. You can have conversations here. Lots of nearby working professionals come here during lunch.

Things started to change a bit years ago with new cooks. Food didn't taste like before, but it was still decent.

I've moved away, but will come back here next time I'm in SF. Thanks Kushi Tsuru for all the memories here.
author: Elle T.

description: Terrible food. Unauthentic japanese food. Very disappointed. I should have listened to all the low rating advice, but i was too hungry and need a place with no line....
author: Manyu L.

description: I ordered spiderman roll takeout.It is $13, just five pieces in the box!!! Sooo much expensive!!! I don't wanna go anymore!!
author: Amber J.

description:
I've been getting take out here for more than a year.  In that time, it's been a pretty consistent spot for not great, but perfectly acceptable bento dinners (you can choose 2 entrees like tempura and teriyaki along with salad and a few CA roll pieces) if you are willing to spend about $15 per bento.

Last night we ordered 2 bentos and the rice had a strange texture, like sticky mashed potatoes.  It was hard to see any individual grains of rice.  The tempura was soggy yet undercooked, and this wasn't helped by them heaping the salmon teriyaki sauce over half of it.  The same mushy rice was used for the CA roll pieces which I couldn't stomach, so I picked out the crab and avocado in the center.

Friend's tonkatsu was a tough, very dark brown crisp.  He finished his bento but commented "Wow, that was hard to eat."  I could barely finish half of mine.

I wanted to call and complain and possibly bring them a sample of the mushy rice, but what could they possibly do? Give me more acceptable rice?  Should I demand a refund for this sad, expensive meal?  

No. Hope is lost here.  Turn back.
author: Jenny S.

description: I, highly suggest this place to eat.. the  , , and curry  where really good!!! Since, we've been wanting to try it. But every time we did, it was busy and a long wait.. just happy that, not that much people came (around 12-1pm).. basically beat the crowd. We haven't tried the  (ramen) since we heard up and down reviews.. but other then than, that come here to eat.. we where surprised this place was open. Since most of the restaurants, at Japan town where closed on Monday's...
author: LeAza D.

description: The sushi was incredible, the service was terrible. They forgot to bring my soup and I didn't get it until everyone had already eaten. My coworker ordered a special roll. with added salmon. The brought out the wrong thing and had to remake it. Servers were not nice. I'll look for good sushi elsewhere.
author: Kat D.

description: Service was good, food was nicely presented and clean, I would recommend it.  I came for dinner on a Saturday at 6:30 and it was only 5minutes before being seated.
author: Lynn W.

description:
This place isn't so bad. It's small just like the other Japanese restaurants in Japangtown. My boyfriend and I ordered the dinner bento box, chicken karage, and Lion King roll. 

The dinner bento box had a few selections for what you wanted with it. I was surprised at how many different options you had versus the normal chicken, beef, salmon teriyaki. There was a variety. 

We ordered the tonkatsu, beef teriyaki dinner bento box. It wasn't bad at all. Was pretty good. The beef was tender and the tonkatsu was yummy. 

The chicken karage was also good. I didn't they the lion king roll my boyfriend had ordered because I was just so full from the dinner bento box granted we already shared the portions. 

Anyway, why didn't I give the place a 5stars... well, the Lion King roll took a while to come out...like towards the end of our meal.

Oh and...we saw a tiny cockroach that was crawling near our table. Literally on the wall, close to my boyfriend. It was practically our friend for the night. Call the exterminator please and get that taken care of. Who knows what they have in their kitchen if there's a creepy crawler in the dining area. Yikes!
author: Marie V.

description: Family favorite japanese restaurant. Never disappointed. Always order the bento boxes. Sushi is great and service is good. We always come back and continue.
author: Laura B.

description: My friends and I have patronized Kushi Tsuru for many years.  It has been consistently good in terms of quality of food and service.  However, I was very disappointed today when I ordered a grilled salmon bento box lunch, with gyoza.  The salmon came in two extremely small pieces and were over cooked (over grilled); the gyoza was a bit on the chewy side.  Hope they haven't fallen on hard times and turned to cheapskate practices.
author: Benjamin T.

description:
My hubby and I were going to the Cherry Blossom Festival in Japan Town and the food selection at the festival was not so great nor authentic Japanese food. So we decided to go inside Japan Center and eat here.
Overall I would actually rate it a 3.5 but I round up if the food is good! 
I had the Katsu Curry which was very flavorful and a huge portion. Leftovers for sure.
My hubby had the Chirashi and he said it was good too. The portion per price was extremely reasonable. 
The restaurant is clean and appears busy all the time. The server forgot my husbands drink and water was never refilled. They presented us with a bill in the middle of dining that had the drink charge on it and someone elses credit card. So I presume they charged this other person for our meal and then had to void the transaction. 
It was at this point the server realized she never brought my husband's drink. No I'm sorry, nothing. As she started to walk away I had to ask, do you think we can have some water?
I will take this experience in stride though because we have dined here before without issue. 
The food is really worth trying. Just might have to stay on top of your server.
author: Andrea T.

description:
Very accommodating service, quick food preparation, and good lunch prices. 

Japantown generally has pretty expensive eateries and many with tight quarters. I came with a large group (10+) and the waitresses were very accommodating to allow us to form one long table. The lunch prices were reasonable ($11-13/person) for bento boxes or noodles. 

I ordered the Tempura Udon and the Lobster Roll. 

The Tempura Udon was very simple, a bowl of Udon with seaweed and one fish cake. The broth was not too salty and there were a good amount of noodles. The Tempura came with about 7 vegetable pieces and one large shrimp. I thought the Tempura side was a good sized portion! They were very greasy however, which lowers my rating. 

The Lobster Roll was delicious. The Lobster Tempura on top of the Roll was the best part for the 8 pieces we got for $14. 

Overall, the quality of the food was mediocre but the relatively cheaper pricing compared to other restaurants in the area slightly justify it. I probably would eat somewhere else if I were in the area. However, the service was very friendly and I was satisfied after eating here
author: Jessica W.

description:
Decided to go here because this was the only place in Japan town that didn't have a 1.5+ hour wait time for a group of 11 on a Sunday afternoon.

We got seated right away and they were able to seat us all together by combining some tables! Staff was friendly and service was really fast. Really liked how they offer lunch specials everyday!

Sadly to say, the food was not as good as their service. Portions for the bento boxes were extremely small and the saba I ordered was super dry and didn't seem fresh at all. Ordered a variety of other foods and this is what I thought:

- Tempura Udon: nothing too special, only gave one little sad fish cake though and the rest was just noodles 
- Miso soup: comes free with the bento box! Slightly too salty for me 
- Vegetable tempura: can never go wrong with fried foods! Gave a really generous amount 
- Salmon Teriyaki: bento portion seemed pretty small and thin and had too much sauce 
- Beef Teriyaki: small portion, taste was sub par
- Sashimi: Gave only 4 slices in the bento box. Definitely had way better sashimi out there
- Lobster roll: proabably my favorite dish ordered. There were 8 pieces and fried lobster covered in sweet sauce on top! 

Overall, I would give the food 2 stars, but because the staff was friendly and service was fast I bumped my rating to 3 stars. Probably wouldn't come here again though.
author: Kelly H.

description: I was really disappointed in the service and the amount of fish actually in the sushi. The waitress made us feel dumb, but we fixed the problem. Except after the problem of the sushi, the waitress didn't like us anymore and decided to ignore us. Oh yeah they'll forget to bring you food so make sure to ask, we never got our miso soup that was supposed to come with our specialty sushi roll
author: Ashlee C.

description:
I don't know how "authentic" the cuisine is but we'll skip over that point.
It's very predictable food for okay prices.
There are definitely other locations around the immediate area with better quality/selection, but for my more "tame palette" friends, this is a safe spot.

Not very delicious or amazing--on par with something you'll find at a large cafeteria that happens to have a "Japanese cuisine" section.

It's always so darn warm in there, and I've only ever seen them running one floor fan.
But that is not their fault--the entire mall has 0 functioning AC EVER, so just be warned.
author: Heidi P.

description: Food poising, old Hamachi which I should've trusted my sinus and not eaten. Decided to trust the chef which is my fault. Avoid if you don't want to lose the gastro battle. My GF puked within 15min of leaving the restaurant, I wasn't very far behind.
author: Eduardo S.

description:
Whenever I come to Japantown, I seem to go to the same Sushi place  it on this night, I thought I would try something different. I have had such a craving for broccoli tempura...I know, odd...what can I say? Anyhoo, I searched their menu posted out front for anything that resembled it...the closest I found was their Ten Don fish which is a few pieces of shrimp and veggies tempura-style on top of rice...close enough. 

As I walked into the restaurant, I was seated quickly and handed a menu which I didn't really need since I knew what I was having but the waitress was busy and I didn't want to be rude and throw my order at her..so I waited, and waited. And waited. And waited some more. I was patient because they were swamped with customers (it was a Friday night). Finally I got to put my order in, Ten Don, house salad and glass of water. Waitress was. Yay, do I excused the lack of friendliness. 

Next came another long stretch of waiting...no biggie, I'm in no hurry and I have plenty to do with my phone. For what seems like eternity, I finally saw my Salad and my sad little miso soup. It was just okay...I'm used to my Salad being cold and crispy not room temp and soggy...oh well.

Finally!!!! My Ten Don!! So excited because I have been craving my tempura veggies!!! And it was...drum roll please....YUCK!!! Well to be honest, the rice was good. The tempura batter was so heavy and slightly sweet...as if they used PANCAKE BATTER??? WHAT?? Gordon Ramsey!! Where are you when I need you to ask them what kind of sh*t is this?? The food was cold, quite the opposite of my salad and as much as I wanted to send it back because 1. I needed to get back to work and 2. We all know what happens when you send food back...

I choked down most of my pancake batter Shrimp and veggies and rice, got the heck out and told myself never again! There are other restaurants there worth trying but not this one!
author: Melody K.

description:
#89/2016

Ambiance 2.25 stars
Service 3.0 stars
Food 4.0 stars

The food was good but the service, lax. 

That said we came at an odd hour (Friday 4:30 pm) during a shift change so I'll cut 'em some slack.

Everything we ordered was good to very good: the shrimp tempura was hot and crispy; the karaage (Japanese fried chicken) was on point and nuclear hot and my little boy's (kid priced but not kid-sized) chicken teriyaki disappeared at breakneck speed so you know it had to be delicious!

My ribeye teriyaki was decent, nothing special. I hoped for more but it was just an okay cut of beef. 

I had to ask for more water twice and flag down our waitress for lemon slices for the karaage and then for our bill. 

Ambiance was early '80s serviceable with a weird fan placed at the end of the small dining room. They could upgrade the space, the food is worthy.

What bothered me most was the horrendous state of the bathroom: SO much graffiti on the inside door (see photo) and sharpied all over the waste paper basket plus it wasn't the cleanest. 

That kind of neglect doesn't happen in a day or a week. It makes me wonder what state their kitchen is in?
author: Jennifer O.

description: Came here for early dinner with boyfriend and daughter. It is family friendly. Customer service was fine. The menu was okay, not expensive. I was actually waiting to have good sushi, but I didn't. The sushi in San Jose is much better than the one they serve here. I'm not impressed knowingly they are in Japantown :/
author: Krystle D.

description: The dishes on the display look amazing, but you will regret it once you sit down since there's no air circulation in there. The melon and strawberry ramune don't taste as good as the original ramune. The eel handroll tasted delicious with the crunchy seaweed. The zaru soba tasted pretty good too. The katsu don tasted mediocre and needed more sauce on it. The nabeyaki udon was alright and nothing special. Overall, you can definitely get better food around.
author: Susan L.

description:
Kushi Tsuru is a reliable spot with nice employees and good food.

It's usually pretty warm (humid) in the store due to lack of air circulation, and sometimes seating is scarce, so don't forget to put your name down.

Although, they're pretty stingy with the rice, which I find odd considering it's a Japanese restaurant.
author: Elsa M.

description: I've been to Kushi Tsuru a few times now and have always had a great experience. It is a classic Japanese diner mostly serving bento boxes, sushi and noodles. It is inexpensive and the quality to price ratio is fantastic. My wife and I have had sushi and bento boxes and have always loved our food. I also like that you can pick what goes into the bento boxes, and they come with tea and a miso soup. This time we visited with our 10-week old baby and had a very easy time. Waiters were accommodating and very patient with us.
author: Thomas L.

description:
I'm 100% sure that in Anthony Bourdain's mind, I have gotten everything that was coming to me.

http://www.foodandwine.com/blogs/2015/10/29/anthony-bourdain%E2%80%99s-6-punishable-death-sushi-donts?xid=soc_socialflow_facebook_fw

You might think I'm being dramatic when I say that this establishment gave me the most miserable meal I've eaten in memory, but I'm going to stick to that anyway.

Like the terrific girlfriend that I am... or, was... I decided to buy my then boyfriend's Christmas 2015 present on *drumroll please* Christmas Eve!  Before you start shaking your head, you should know that I waited that long because I wanted to get him something very particular, a bonsai tree, which you can't just get through Amazon.  (Actually, you can... but... ignore that for dramatic effect)  After searching up purveyors of bonsai, I was stuck between Katsura Garden, SF and Grove Way Bonsai Nursery, Hayward.

Realizing that I still needed to buy gifts for a number of other people, too, I decided to stop by Katsura Garden and then buy a bunch of other things in Japantown (yay, efficiency!).  It was a cold, windy December 24th when I parked in the garage and commenced browsing and buying, swiping plastic like the credit card ninja that I am, crossing names off my list faster than the nonexistent Santa Claus (HE DOESN'T EXIST; YOUR PARENTS ARE LYING TO YOU).  Ahem.

I finished a couple of hours later and was absolutely exhausted.  In retrospect, I shouldn't have purchased the bonsai first; that thing was heavy and hard to tote around from shop to shop.  As I passed through the mall, I decided to stop and eat before I drove home.  Hunger really must have messed with my mind and short-circuited my ability to think rationally (I have demonstrated sanity at times, I swear).  Instead of whipping out my Yelp app and making a wise choice, I swerved to the right and ended up at Katsura.

I was seated immediately and experienced pretty attentive service the whole way through.  There were two waitresses that made sure that everyone in the packed dining area had everything they needed.  One star for that.

The menu had pretty typical offerings.  In the end, I settled on a beef curry rice bowl ($10.95) and an order of... dun dun dun... California rolls ($4.50)!  

After placing my order, one of the waitresses brought me a cup of toasted rice tea and a bowl of miso soup.  The tea was good and the miso soup was decent (a tad bit too salty, but what can ya do).  Minutes later, the same waitress brought over the rolls and the rice bowl.

I attacked the rolls first.

Halfway through chewing the first roll, my heart sank.  They hadn't even bothered to season the rice at all.  Shamelessly hungry, I ate three more before pushing the plate away.  

The sloppy presentation of the beef curry rice bowl didn't inspire much confidence and one bite confirmed my suspicions - utter crap.  They really should rename this "lukewarm bowl of curry sauce over a scoop of soggy rice," and make the description read: "have fun playing the Where's Waldo? game with the miniscule bits of 'beef' swimming around."  But maybe that's too much to fit on a menu. 

I took a couple more bites before asking for the check.

When the waitress asked if I wanted takeout containers I didn't know whether to burst out into maniacal laughter or glare at her.  Seriously??  

All snark aside, I think this place is a prime example of what truly disappoints me, that is, restaurants that take zero pride in what they do, places that seem to exist solely to churn out plated slop for profit.
author: Iona C.

description:
Kushi Tsuru is one of the many sushi places inside of the mall in Japantown. You don't come here looking for sushi that will blow your mind. It's a casual, unassuming place for when you don't feel like splurging. Special rolls are priced between $11-14, which is not bad! The portion size is pretty solid too - you get about 8 pieces. Each special roll comes with miso soup, which is fantastic for a cold or rainy day wandering around Japantown - completely delicious. We had the Hotel California and another roll whose name escapes me (it had tempura shrimp and spicy tuna on top). Both were actually quite good! Not the best sushi I've had but it does the trick! I liked how the lime on the Hotel California paired with the fish itself and the slightly sweet sauce at the bottom of the plate. And you can't go wrong with tempura shrimp!

The one major caveat I have with this spot is the service. We did come on an admittedly busy evening, but I don't think that's a good enough excuse. When we recited our order to our water (it was simple, just two rolls) she then repeated the order and it wasn't what we had said. I had to ask for hot water with lemon twice and when it came, there wasn't lemon. It took another two rounds of asking for lemon before I got it. I wasn't asking for much, so this peeved me a bit. It also took quite some time for the miso to come out, which shouldn't be that way given miso is pre-prepared in bulk.

Apart from the service, which perhaps wasn't how it usually is, this place is decent!
author: Sabina S.

description: First time here on a Thursday lunch hour with the family. Waited 30 minutes to sit at a table and 30 minutes more for our noodles to come. Sushi, however, took 5 minutes to come. The overall taste is average. Likely we'll not be back.
author: Tony H.

description: The udon here is terrible. Noodles are soggy and the broth is so so so SALTY. I poured my whole cup of water into the soup and it was still super salty. I walked in and was seated. Immediately I noticed how the mats on the booth was stained. The table had dried up teriyaki sauce and the waitress did not clean it until I asked her. When she did come and clean it, she merely brushed the cloth on the table, I ended up having to clean the table off myself. The waitress was not affable nor was she attentive. I think the server from the other table played more attention than the one from mine. I do not recommend this place.
author: Zhennifo C.

description: The food was Reasonably priced. We were Seated promptly, probably could stand to be updated. Bento lunch box was a good value, I had the salmon teriyaki which was tasty and nicely cooked.
author: Cyndi F.

description: Came in here with the fam for lunch. In Japanese kushi means "skewers", but there was not a skewer type item on the menu. Anyway, I had the katsu don for my lunch which was flavorful and what I expected. My mom ordered the teriyaki chicken, which was a little sweet for my taste, but my mom enjoyed it. My dad had the deep fried flounder (karei), which they also presented as a waxed food display in the glass case in front. That flounder was really tasty. I actually liked it better than my dish. Would come here again.
author: Kenson K.

description:
Let me say this was probably the first Japanese food that I could say disappointed me! and I've eaten in maybe a thousand different Japanese restaurants over my lifetime..In my defense we were going to go to Kappa but found out it was by reservation only, then we decided to head to "AN" but found they only serve seafood which one of my kid couldn't eat and all those walking around our hunger took over us and next thing we found ourselves seated at this Japanese resto called Kushi Tsuru 

We ordered, service was good, nice ladies but when the food came I could tell my calamari dinner wasn't going to be like the calamari I was used to eating, sure enough it was old, sort of hard, I had to man up and finish it or it would send the wrong message to my kids that wasting food is ok.

Next, my GF didn't finish her fried/tempura calamari so I did the honorable thing of taking over her leftover food, and ohh lol it was old calamari..I just didn't enjoy the food!

I know we should have tried harder to search Yelp for better alternatives when our 1st two didn't pan out, but we were a famished family that made a decision to stop Yelping for better food and just go for it! well lesson learn ;-)
author: Peter A.

description:
I ordered Katsu curry. I was very surprised they served ramen bowl. curry was very cold and taste very bad. Price 13 dollars. 
Not so cheap. 
Curry is very easy to cook Japanese food and it is delicious in Japan. 
This is fake Japanese foods. 

I never come back to this restaurant.
author: Nishigami T.

description: Order the chicken teriyaki and the meet was so dry you could hardly chew it. Chicken Katsu was better but the sauce was awful. I The girl who took my take-out order was very rude, not friendly at all. I do not recommend this place at all.
author: Kathleen H.

description: I went here because it was very convenient. The pictures were nice, and I was quite hungry. The staff was affable, and moderately attentive. I have to admit that the food was wildly disappointing. I almost thought I had received the wrong dish because it was so drastically off from what had been pictured. I can forgive the aesthetics, but the flavor was the real clincher. I can only describe the chicken as suspicious, and the texture as concerning. I actually bookmarked the business because this dish was so disappointing. It was beyond me that such a poor meal could be served in San Francisco considering the city's well-deserved culinary prowess. There are just so many other better places to go. Again, the staff was fine, but the meal fell very short of my expectations. I can't in good conscience recommend this place if this is the normal caliber of food they serve.
author: Ben R.

description:
Cockroaches crawled across table during dinner. We jumped up, paid bill, darted out! Worst restaurant in Japantown. Was such a dissapointment b/c Japan Town is my favorite chill spot. Seeing this broke my heart.

Owner absolutely MUST know and just does not care. I regret paying bill + tip.
author: You H.

description: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING. Came here for lunch on a Thursday at 3:30pm; hardly anyone here and we got seated almost immediately so that was nice. Took another 15 minutes for our drink order to be taken, so we ended up putting our food and drink order together. We honestly had little to no service from the staff; going as far to chase them down 35 minutes later when our food hadn't arrived. At that point NO ONE SAID ANYTHING TO US about where the hell our food was. My boyfriend practically walked into the kitchen to find someone to cancel my order because it took so long I wasn't even hungry anymore. When we spoke to a staff member, he explained that the wait was so long because the server forgot to enter our order in the system. My response? Why is it that she never told us what was going on? He pretty much acknowledged that she f'ed up, but still, nothing to be done to make it right. We'll pass on this place next time
author: Courtney R.

description:
Catipilar Roll & Screaming Roll |$26.48| 
Since it was a warm day my friend and I wanted to eat something not hot but not cold like desserts. We settled for this place because it had appetizing cooked sushi rolls. (since we don't like raw fish). The sushi came on one big plate and was placed nicely. They didn't give us a plate, so sadly we had to ask for it ourselves. The sushi itself was good and not too flavorful which I like. Overall my experience at this place was good and I would definitely come more often if it wasn't this far away.
author: Terilyn W.

description: A solid 3. Not the worst not the best. Service was quick and friendly enough. Maybe it was our location but they did forget to refill my partners hot tea when making their rounds. Very good prices and average food. We probably would come back if everywhere else is a long wait like it was yesterday. I ordered a California roll and a spicy hamachi roll. Jen W. got a bento box with shrimp tempura and chicken teriyaki. The portions were all good. My rolls were decently sized but the rice was just meh which makes the rolls just ok. My wife's bento box came with miso soup, salad, 2 piece California roll, and the two entrees she ordered which is not bad for a lunch special at $11.95. The prices for my rolls were also a value at about $6.95 each.
author: Guisela L.

description: Japan Center how I love this place. I first discovered this with my ex bf on the mainland and a mutual friend we were helping relocate to the Bay Area so about 2004. She lived so close to here and we arrived jes in time for their Cherry Blossom festival we enjoyed a little bit of Japan from the Bay area perspective of Japanese immigrated or relocated to the Bay Area. This area holds everything Japanese so it is not a surprise we had dinner here with one of my long time friends who made the trek from San jose to visit us during our travels. This restaurant was quaint and the waitress were clearly from Japan. We ordered sushi rolls, udon soup and edamame. It took a little while to arrive but we enjoyed conversating  with one another. When it arrived we were impress with the simple but nice layout. My cherry blossom roll was yummy as it consist of avocado and sashimi salmon inside and avocado and sashimi ahi on top. The udon bowl i ordered for Tala was huge and we ended up sharing this. Overall we had a pleasant time here.
author: Cecile Kikilia A.

description: Decided to try something new and regretted it. Right when we sat down it smelled strongly of a cleaning agent. We mentioned this and asked to move to another table and they obliged but not before saying "really?" Ordered ramen, some rolls and the sashimi salads. The ramen had two tiny pieces of meat. All of the portions were small and not tasty at all. I was hoping for at least good service but that was seriously lacking as well. In the end we felt rushed to leave.
author: Victor X.

description:
This place is fairly average. We were served water and miso soup after being seated. The place is a little lacking in service as others had mentioned, but we at least got a refill on water without having to ask.

I ordered two rolls and was content with the turnout. Worth the money in my opinion since the flavors were good for both Mango Crunch and Godzilla. It just took a bit longer to come out compared to the boyfriend's Unagi Don.

Food wasn't mind blowing but again, worth the price in my opinion.
author: Karen T.

description: Was so hungry so I went here. They didn't know one of us was Vietnamese and the workers just kept talking shiz. We ordered a couple of sushi rolls and some noodle soups. I've had better. In fact I have made better sushi. You get like no privacy, the customers next to us totally didn't know what they wanted and just wanted what we ordered. Kept looking over at our food. The guy even sat on my backpack next to me cause there is a side of the wall that has a long bench. Not coming back.
author: Eva B.

description:
*Disclaimer, this was literally the first meal I had after coming home from Japan, so I may be biased and have unrealistic expectations from Japanese food.

We decided to stop by Japantown to grab some food. We weren't feeling particularly picky, and we've been to most of the restaurants here, so we just decided to pick whichever one. We ended up here at Kushi Tsuru.

I had eaten the most delicious bowl of Gyu-don in Japan, which had been very cheap (300 yen ~$3) and it came from a food court. I was still thinking about that when I ordered to Gyu-don here. I just ended up very disappointed. The meat was really dry and overdone. I only had a few bites before losing my appetite.

We also got a Tempura Udon, and they served the udon without the tempura. The tempura didn't come out until the udon was already half eaten. The flavor was also pretty bland and uninteresting.

Trying not to hate on this place, because I've never had such a big issue with it in the past. Like I said, I'm probably biased since I had just come back from Japan. Regardless, this place doesn't serve the most high quality Japanese food, but it is decent if you're in the area and just want to grab something to eat.
author: Helen W.

description: Ordered a Katsu Don. It took forever and a half for it to make it to my table. When I got it, the egg was super runny. Not sure if the egg was suppose to cook itself or if they were in a rush. I watched my bf eat his meal for the most part while I waited for my food. They didn't refill our drinks and just the waiting for my dish was the most frustrating part, especially since they had to re-do it since the egg was raw the first time around. The only positive is their chicken yakitori. First time and last time here!
author: Roseanne R.

description: Sushi was fucking terrible. Worst sushi I have ever had in my entire life and I've been all over Asia and America. Rice was practically a week old. I was hungry and didn't even want to eat this. Take my advice and do not go here.
author: Jullian B.

description:
We randomly selected this restaurant for dinner one night, and while there seems to be a fairly equal amount of recent good and bad reviews, I thought dinner wasn't bad.

I ordered the Combo Entree with gyoza, chicken katsu, and california roll since I wanted to eat a bit of everything.  Gyoza was a bit hard on the edges but the chicken katsu was crunchy and tasty.  I mistakenly ordered a Nabeyaki Udon when I wanted soba, but I actually liked it.  Big bowl filled with udon, an egg, tempura, tofu, fish cakes, and other vegetables.  Broth was good, overall satisfying.

I definitely wouldn't mind coming back again.
author: Karen L.

description: We can see why this place is a hit or miss for a few. We had a positive experience here though. We came here during dinner time on the weekend and was seated right away. We went for safety meals and ordered the beef udon and a bento with teriyaki salmon and chicken karaage. We liked that the miso soup is complimentary here. My bento came with a salad and two pieces of California rolls. The udon was a little on the salty side, but it came with about 5 big pieces of meat. The waitresses always came around to refill our teas. I noticed that the couple next to us ordered a few rolls, which actually looked pretty enticing so maybe we'll give it try next time. The other couple to our other side was waiting for a long time as the kitchen forgot one of their orders. But overall, if you're here for a quick meal it's an okay place.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Kushi Tsuru is a very elegant name for a place that isn't all that elegant; it's a lot like any other restaurant down in restaurant row for J-town, so honestly, you may have accidentally walked into here and couldn't tell which restaurant you were in. That's okay.

My review is mainly for the curry. I was wandering around, sad, alone, by myself, and I ended up here. I'd never tried this place, but it's been around for years, ever since I was in middle school. I figured it was time to give it a go. I had just finished crying. I needed comfort food. I had already tried On the Bridge and that place looked too happy and the people there were too kind, so I didn't really want to be seen.

You need places like this, where it's okay to dine by yourself and where the waiters don't really need to care THAT much - just enough to seat you, take your order, bring your food, and then get your check taken care of. Kushi Tsuru did just that.

The curry was actually quite good. I admit I was surprised; this curry got classified as "close to the one back in Kyoto Daigaku" for me. The portion was pretty huge and was only about $10. I ate about half when I got really full. I still had enough for two separate meals for the next couple of days. It also came with a croquette and meat, which was surprising to me. It's the only place I know that serves korokke curry in J-town so far, and that's by far my favorite. Plus, I didn't really have to order anything extra on top of it. They also serve your meal with miso soup, which has more flavor than other miso soups I've had. I know miso soup is supposed to be pretty plain, but whatever the flavor was there was pretty good, and I'm okay with having that as a soup.

I wouldn't mind coming back here if I'm wandering around aimlessly in Japantown again. If it's empty, I'll be here, because I know what I want to order, and I know that I'll likely have a booth to myself if necessary.
author: Robbin A.

description: Got here at 2pm. They took almost 15 minutes to ask us what we wanted. Then they never brought us our food. They gave everyone else but us their food, even people who came after us. Weirdly enough we were the only non-Asian customers there and were pretty much being ignored. Once we confronted the staff why we never got our food, they straight up said they forgot about our food and didn't apologize or seem to even fake that they felt sorry about it. They were very excited for us to pay for the drinks we ordered and leave though. How weird that it was just our food they forgot about. We left after almost an hour.
author: Mellany Q.

description:
My BF and I went here due to limited time and options in the Japan Center mall @ Japantown. The sauce that drenched all of the fish sushi made me aware there was something to hide & had way too much sodium.

I would opt to go somewhere else and was not able to hold it down after a stomach turning session only minutes after leaving
author: Sabrina P.

description:
One of the many restaurants to choose from in "Restaurant Row" AKA the dark little tunnel of food in Japantown with the windows of delicious-looking food displays that you can't.. help.. but stare at..

...and so that's how we ended up in here!

We were seated and provided with hot green tea and miso soup immediately, which was a nice surprise. The menu consisted of the typical Japanese fare, such as sushi, udon, and donburi. It was nice to also see the option of udon or soba for all of the noodle dishes.

The quality, however, was nothing too special. I ordered the beef udon and the cuts of beef were none too visually appealing, nor was the broth very flavorful. It wasn't bad but not particularly amazing either. While prices were fair for the amount given, I don't know if I could say the same for taste.

Service was passable and fairly quick but not especially friendly. Overall, a decent option if you happen to be in Japantown and all of the other restaurants are crowded.
author: Brittney K.

description:
There are other restaurants in Japantown that are far better than Kushi Tsuru. 

Service: 1 
Food: 2.5

The service here is extremely slow. After ordering we waited over 30 minutes for our food. 2 of the orders came out and then we waited another 10 minutes before the next 2 dishes came out. My 5 year old daughter had ordered udon, which we had to ask about where it was. 10 minutes later, the waiter came to ask if we had ordered udon. I said yes, we ordered it and he said "Oh, I thought you said she'd just eat from your dishes."  What!?  Where would he get that idea?  The udon took another 5 minutes to come out. 

Food. I've had better. Bento box with chicken Katsu and tonkatsu. It was just like any other Katsu. Nothing special. Bento box-beef teriyaki and tempura shrimp. The teriyaki was good but the tempura was not-greasy and no flavor. Bento box chicken karage and salmon teriyaki. They were okay. The udon was okay. The Unaju, a bit on the sweet side.  

Bathrooms: 1 men and 1 women stall shared with Mifune next door. VERY small stall.
author: Amy K.

description: So I came here with my mother and it really was an experience... I'd like to say that our waitress was really nice about the whole situation. The food that we received was cold. It was colder than room temperature. Our waitress gladly brought it back to the kitchen, while we were waiting for the plate to come back, we spotted a HUGE rat that ran past us. It freaked us out so much, our waitress offered to cancel the order, so we did. Honestly was a really disgusting experience.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Mini me love things Japanese. From the food to the toys, anime and the trinkets she is just one of those kids who are so into it that whenever you say you're going to any place that resembles a touch of Nippon she would literally lit up from her usually cranky-hormone driven self. Having this in mind, I know she would love to go to Japantown and would love to have dinner in one of its restos. It's like a done deal, give mommy a pat on the back - but no. It wasn't what I would have expected. 

She enjoyed Japan town alright but coming to this place left us feeling dissatisfied with the food and especially the service. Why did I felt this? Let me count the ways...
1. The place is small the it couldn't accommodate our party of eight. We were told that we can have separate tables. Which we agreed since we were starving already.
2. We needed a high chair for my friend's baby and they gave us one- a broken one. My friend questioned why are they giving us a chair with broken straps. They just shrugged and told us that they only have two and the owner has not fixed the chair yet. My friend insisted that they should fix it before some child falls off from their chair. We got no apologies.
3. Time of taking our order after we complained about the high chair. 10 minutes.
4. Time of getting our orders. More than 15 minutes. 
5. Minutes waited for spoon and fork after our meal was delivered. 5 mins and it was only spoons. I guess when they say one moment, it meant 5 minutes of wasted expectations.
6. Minutes waited for the forks. 5 more minutes (seriously where are they getting it???) Did I say we were starving?
7. Did someone asked us how we were doing? No... Not until minutes before the bill arrived ( however they were checking in with the other tables who came later than us). Seriously I felt like we were being ignored if not "just" tolerated.
 8. Food - I am being nice when I say that their food was mediocre. The miso soup was way salty. The bento box we ordered were comparable with cheap food court stalls. The karaage chicken has a very sour special sauce and the meal was just- ehhh... Tho my brother said that the beef teriyaki was good while my friend's calamari was sub par.
9. My daughter who decided to eat in a different table shouted to our side that she can't finish her food grilled salmon because it's making her dizzy and with the  blunt innocence every honest kid has , she said, "I didn't like the food! "... I seriously don't know how to react...yet somehow am proud of her braveness of telling it as it is - down right loud and clear....ahhh youth... Is a bliss!
10. My daughter's order of California roll never came.
11. When we got our bill it included a 18% tip. Which was appalling for the service we receive. My friend gave them a piece  of her mind and met into agreement in the end. They still got a tip but not by their terms. 

If you have to eat Japanese food, try somewhere else.
author: Joy U.

description:
Review for the lunch bento of korean shortribs, vegetable tempura and 3 pieces of CA roll. Small place with a few tables, quick service...food was tasty but CA roll seemed a little mushy. 

Overall, good lunch value the whole week with a few small pieces of shortribs...i would say 1 strip cut into 3 sections but still filling...good way to get your parking ticket validated.
author: Cheryl M.

description:
Oh man...
The sushi roll didn't even have sushi rice.  What?!

The mango crunch roll I had was mushy, exactly like the sushi you can buy at Trader Joe's or Safeway. If they used sushi rice, it would've been great.

My boyfriend had the Oyako Don because the display outside looked delicious with a runny egg omelette. The one that came to our table was over cooked and didn't really look appetizing. Regardless, he enjoyed the bowl & was stuffed before he could finish the entire thing. 

The monkey brain was pretty good, and the only thing here that didn't really disappoint. This restaurant, along with the others along restaurant row just seem to leave me wanting more. 

The food came out pretty quick, but service is slow especially if you're seated in the back... It'll be easy for you to feel forgotten back there. :(

If you have to eat here, I'd say to skip the sushi and go for the bento boxes or bowls.
author: Christine W.

description:
I followed some positive notes I've seen from some other Yelpers I respect, and I am always up to try out a restaurant that maybe hasn't collected the best average over the years.

The fried rolls seem to be the go-to for positive reviews, and I could totally see that in both the plating and the overall flavor. The roll size was much larger than I anticipated, I could have easily ordered just one fried roll and been stuffed.

Things went a bit downhill when I got to my unagi temaki, I got a bit of that less-than-fresh flavor that immediately makes me stop eating. It was the end of the night too, so maybe I just got unlucky.

I do understand where other reviewers found four stars when it comes to the battered items, but maybe just have your visit start and end with those.

Atmosphere: Minimal wood interior, windows facing to the interior of the Kintetsu Mall. Good for people watching if you're into that

Try: Spiderman II Roll - it is like a super sized spider roll

Note: I saw they have a "Screaming Orgasm Roll" on the menu, I can't say I had one
author: Taylor S.

description:
Food was alright. Bento box gives you a good variety. 

Mainly touristy. We had a large party like 15 people and were in the back room. Chairs were hard wood and uncomfortable on your back.

Would be better if they had air conditioning, was stuffy. they had one very strong fan blowing, but it did not help too much, and the person sitting in front of the fan was too cold.
author: Veranna N.

description:
Kushi Tsuri was located in the center of the mall(s), and probably has the most traffic on the outside because it's located where all of the restaurants are. Looking at the lunch specials, we were pretty interested in the bento boxes. For $10.95 each, we got the bento box and the beef don for $9.95. The bento box included two options of thins we wanted in the bento box. We chose Chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura. In addition, there was salad, rice and California rolls. 

I thought the rice was overly wet, so it kind of ruined the California rolls, the rice alone and the beef don. The salad was a little unJapanese like. The sauce wasn't the normal chopped carrot sauce that many Japanese restaurants make themselves, it was normal Caesar Salad Dressing. The shrimp didn't taste very fresh, nor was it fried very well. The chicken was pretty average. One of the good parts about this meal was the egg and the beef in the don buri. I thought the beef was very flavourable, the egg was on the slightly good side, though it wasn't amazing. 

There's many restaurants in JapanTown, I would recommend walking around because there are so many food shops that look really good!
author: Kristy N.

description: I've been hunting down some good beef teriyaki and this one's okay. I like it but It could have been better. The staff was really nice and the menu is affordable. A bit small but it's okay. Wait time? I didn't wait too long.
author: Kat P.

description:
This restaurant is located in Japan centre in the area that looks traditional but more of that cheesy tourist japan look that caters to tourists. Which also gave us hints that the place wouldn't be that great, also it just didn't seem or feel authentic when you walked in. We were really hungry in the moment so we just decided to do a Yelp search and go to the nearest decently rated place. (YAY FOR YELP!!!)

Anyways, our assumptions were true because the food we ate was mediocre at best. The miso soup you could see msg and salt particles or whatever powder they used for there miso soup. It really turned me off because I could feel the particles of the miso soup, usually it's suppose to be more dissolved than that.

 For the main course, we got the chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura bento box that came with salad, rice and california rolls and we got the donburi, which is like rice with beef, onions, egg, and some sauce to give it some flavour, most likely fat from the beef. The beef was alright but not as great quality as I've had at other really good donburi places (This place literally called Donburi in Richmond Hill, ON, Canada) where the beef would literally melt in your mouth and would be super tasty. And yes the sauce felt like it was just fat / oil secreted from the beef. The California rolls were pretty tasteless as well but shrimp tempura was alright.

I wouldn't go back, but I'd love to try somewhere new in JapTown and see.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Ambience was ok.. other restaurants in Japan town has better ambience . Sushi was ok. I would say average. 
Price was reasonable . The Jalapeño bomb was the best.. 
6/10 overall rating .
author: Smartyr R.

description:
Yeah, the 3 star rating here is about right. 

I wouldn't recommend sushi here. The fish tasted FROZEN...  ~let it go~ let it go~~  oh sorry... 

Every place around was busy... I settled here. I wasn't expecting much and it was just that. 

Staff seemed chaotic running around all over the place.
author: Kiyo M.

description:
The food here is very average. It isn't very high quality and doesn't taste amazing, but it's clean and edible. I had the Shoyu Ramen with sake bomb ($9). The ramen broth was a very basic soy sauce base, which was definitely too salty. The content of the ramen wasn't bad: a good heaping of noodles, two tender pieces of pork, and a lot of seaweed and menma (which didn't taste very fresh). The highlight of the meal was actually the sake bomb combo, which was only $9, but included a small carafe of sake (good enough for 3.5 shots), and a large bottle of beer. 

Bonus for good service when we misordered - for some reason we asked for 3 bowls of ramen when we only wanted 2, and they just took the last one back and didn't make an issue of it.

I don't think I would return here unless I really needed to have a meal in Japantown - from what I've had inside the center, the food is all around the same caliber. Kushi Tsuru isn't any better or worse than the neighboring restaurants.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Good udon , very hot on a iron bowl, sushi are fresh, 
I order a tofu dish,  waitress didn't warn about the super hot fried tofu, my daughter got burn her tounge
author: Ngocart N.

description: Since Mifune moved to a new location, I decided to give this place a shot. I ordered the Shrimp Tempura Don to-go. The rice was the size of a scoop of ice cream! I was very disappointed. They don't even offer you hot tea while you wait for your meal. Mifune would offer hot tea while I wait. Don't waste your money here!
author: Lyric A.

description:
Ramen was way too salty and the tempura was so greasy I didn't even want to touch it. Worst of all, ended up with stomach pains and instant bathroom runs. 
Never coming back!
author: Grace L.

description: Don't ever order chicken karaage. This server was tryna argue with me because the chicken was not cooked through. It was so pink She said it's the marinade. Okay there's marinade, but the chicken does not suppose to look that way. I said it's okay I don't want it anymore. She agreed to void it but she went back to me and insisted that it was cooked: And she still wants to argue. YOU KNOW WHAT, EAT YOUR FUCKING SALMONELLA IF THAT'S COOKED FOR YOU, WELL IT WAS NOT. You can't eat chicken like steak with rare, medium rare, medium well, or whatnot. Chicken should be well done in any way! You don't want that salmonella girl. Hope you have the willingness to learn your lesson. Shame on you. I was so surprise that instead of showing good customer service, she argued with me.
author: Ichai D.

description:
we used to like this place. they were nice and they were trying but... 

1. used napkins. really?!
2. the menu was gross...teriyaki stains and hair.
3. no chopsticks-had to steal from another table.

And now for the food:
nabeyaki udon. about $13
came with old fish cake, 2 tiny bits of chicken, soggy tempura, no vegetables.

i think new ownership? 

sad sad sad
author: El B.

description: So I went to this place only bec there was no wait --you'll know why after reading this and since we were in a rush. First I found PLASTIC in my udon. How do you find plastic in your udon? If this was one of those plastic packaged instant udon that's selling in stores for less than $3 for a pack they were selling for $14 shame on them. So waitress says sorry and just takes the plate then brings a new one out. ASSUMING this is Complimentary due to their previous screw up. Then as soon as I check the bill they charged us for the udon... ?? If a restaurant screws up on an order by dropping PLASTIC inside someone's meal, wouldn't the udon be complimentary? I mean correct me if I'm wrong but no restaurant I have been to ever charged for their mistake. I asked why they charged and waitress said it's bec they made a new one. Uh yes you did because you screwed up on my first one. After seeing that I lost my appetite so I didn't even want to stay there. I told them I didn't even ask them for another one but they kept on denying... one of the most ridiculous customer service ever no wonder there is no wait and 3 stars. I'd rate this place negative stars if there was an option. Then waitress had the audacity to say "next time tell us you dont want another one". Hello wake up here, there is no next time for some poor service restaurant like this one. Do NOT bother if customer service means alot to your dining experience.
author: Lauren K.

description: Last night, I ordered a tempura udon and my fiancé ordered a godzilla roll. The sushi was alright. It's just that the Layers of fish was so thin. But it was drenched in some vinegar sauce. The udon was alright. But for the price, not really worth it. Tempura udon came with batter fried vegetables and one small piece of shrimp. It wasn't that great. Overall, it's a small tight area and the ladies there are nice. This isn't my first time here but the food isn't just a wow factor for me.
author: Kim F.

description:
If you go, please go during lunchtime for the special prices! I remember I went here last year and thought it was fine, so when i went for dinner this time I was so surprised at the prices. It wasn't worth it for the prices, but hey, it's SF right? 

We got the beef curry (VERY filling), soba noodles, and the Spiderman roll. (Nothing else seemed worth for the money lol). My friend was so disappointed to find out she paid ~$12 for 4 pieces of sushi. We gave her some of our curry. I was thirsty the whole time and the service wasn't too great. We rarely were checked up on (water pls) and waited forever for the food. It started getting fuller around 6pm on a Monday night. 

The bathroom is.... gross. There was a cockroach in there.

Would maybe??????? come back for lunch but not for regular-priced dinner. Just an average Japanese food place.
author: Michelle V.

description:
The food is alright. Nothing spectacular, but not bad for the price.

The service, however, was terrible. I sat down and didn't get my order taken for probably around ten minutes (even though it was closed). I also didn't get water until after my order came. Finally, they forgot the soup that came with my meal. All in all, a decent meal but with poor service.
author: Robert A.

description:
First time here.

Service was normal. Only one server didn't have to wait.

Food we ordered 3 rolls and Tofu 
Rolls was too sweet! 
Tofu was ok.

Place is good for small parties like 5 people or so.
author: Mack A.

description:
For the longest time, I really wanted to try Kushi Tsuru.  However, since my friends back then would inexplicably insist on eating next door at Mifune (the food wasn't even that good!), I never got the chance.  Fast forward to a few years ago and, despite finally making my way here, the urge to come here started growing all over again.  Cravings?  Hardly.  No, it's all just because I never finished this review.  Ugh.

Since my last trip here, both the menu's look and its array of offerings have been updated.  There seems to be more rolls now, but the menu still tilts towards hot dishes (bento boxes, dinner combos, entrees, ramen, soba, udon, donbouri, etc.).  It was cool to see the San Francisco Fire still on the menu, but the relatively unique bento box combos were what caught my eye this time.  Of the half dozen or so varieties, I opted for the TSURU BENTO, which included a Mini Chiraishi, Mixed Tempura, 3 pcs of Kappa Maki, 3 pcs of Nigiri, and Miso Soup.  

Although it looked okay, the whole thing was pretty underwhelming.  Of the bunch, the Tempura was the only part that was fine.  I figured the Kappa Maki (Cucumber Roll) would be pretty generic, but the cuts of Hamachi, Tuna, and Salmon weren't very good.  The Chiraishi was even more disappointing though - a piece of shrimp, slices of fake crab, and some tamago aren't what come to mind when I think of "chiraishi".

Oddly enough, despite my experience, I feel like Kushi Tsuru could still be a decent option if only because of the size and variety of the menu (it can't all be bad, right?).  Plus, while there are clearly better places in SF, you could certainly do worse within Japantown (*cough* Mifune *cough*).
author: Mike L.

description: Decent dinner for Father's Day today. On the salty side. Maybe because we had dinner late and the soup stock and curry was at the bottom of the pot which is crusty and saltier? We like coming here because the staff is friendly, it's more quiet, and not as crowded as the other restaurants. Will return whenever we visit J-Town!
author: ViVi T.

description: Amazing and original japanese cuisine.  Its hard to find real Japanese food in SF but i finally found it.  Tommy the chef has been cooking for 40 years and is from Okinawa.  His cooking expertise is shown through his delicious cooking.  Price is so reasonable compared to the quality of food that you get.
author: lauren n.

description: We took our daughter to Japan town for the first time. There were several Japanese restaurants in the plaza to choose from. We started off with Jalapeno bomb appetizer which was not too spicy and the Mango crunch sushi rolls with avocado, salmon, hamachi and mango. Hubby had the beef short ribs teriyaki bento box. They had dishes that we never had before like the Jalapeno bomb and Mango crunch sushi which were new and interesting to try.
author: Racquel E.

description: A busy restaurant in Japantwn. The wait was short though. Typical decor for a Japanese restaurant. Service was prompt and the food came out quickly. Chicken Karage was moist and flavorful. Sukiyaki was delicious. The bento boxes were generous. All the food was good and we'll return for sure.
author: Ron T.

description:
Food was good. Lady in the glasses who split our checks at the cash register got mad when my friend didn't tip her. When she saw that I didn't tip, she FLUNG MY CARD AT ME. Then when both of my friends proceeded to pay for their food she gave them attitude asking where we're from. Maybe we would have tipped if they constantly checked up on us or didn't screw up my order. Anyways thanks for ruining our SF trip lady in glasses. I feel sorry for the workers who have to work with her. 

We also didn't tip because the struggle is real. 

Foods cool but if you want your day ruined, don't go for service :-)
author: Char C.

description:
Had the bento box with the Calamari and Beef Teriyaki options.
Presentation was nice and so was the beef, but the calamari was chunky and tasteless covered with a greasy tempura.  Two small Califora Sushi pieces were served with wilted ginger and  NO Wasabi?!?!     Isn't that the point to cheap Sushi?     A small bowl if Miso Soup was served first and that was really very good.  I may go back for soup or noodles someday.  Almost everyone else there was eating out of bowl.
author: John W.

description: The food was epic , the waiters were fast and quick and we didn't wait for so long.our food came fast and hot and we were happy with japantown because it takes you back to history.
author: Ottp S.

description: It's ok. An for all the restaurants nearby in the hall of Japantown. This is the best one for the variety, price and service I need when I am with my kids AND I can count on the consistency. My kids just want Udon and the other Zaru Soba and for me it's something like a bento. The prices are really good and they have ok sushi. If you want sushi I wouldn't recommend here, but for the kids who want Tamago it's fine. It's not overly big to where you can't get help like other places and their Miso tastes good. My kids actually always ask to just eat here.
author: Lisa H.

description: I came here on Sunday and had amazing sushi like the baked salmon roll and also had the Jalapeno Bombs which were bomb! I'm here again tonight enjoying their pork ramen and steamed gyoza's which were AMAZING!! I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town!
author: Kammie J.

description: Worst service ever. I planned on not tipping them cus of the service but then for some reason they've already added tip to my bill  so I went ahead and paid and left as quickly as possible. Worst service in the plaza.
