author: Amy X.

description: I ordered its salmon teriyaki combo. The fish tasted as if it had been drenched in the restaurant's teriyaki sauce, which was too sweet.
author: Sydney C.

description: Made me pay $6.65 more after carefully calculating our payment in cash. :) Overcharge much?
author: Shaymin N.

description:
Me and my boyfriend decided to give this restaurant, which located in J town, a try. When we first be seated, a waitress served us with 2 bowl of miso soup and 2 cups of cold water. 

Later we ordered fried soft shell crab... Um.. Not bad, not bad for now. Nothing special really. 

We also order the calamari and sashimi salad. The calamari is pretty good. 

However, the sashimi salad is worst than "nothing special". It only comes with one veggie, which is lettuce, variety of diced sashimi (not quite fresh), seaweed salad, and rice(?) (yes rice in the middle of the salad). It comes with a spicy sesame dressing, which I don't think it matches with the salad. I would give no star to this sashimi salad. 
(PS:: the complimentary salad is tasted way better than this $15 sashimi salad) 

One thing to point out is that their service is really good. The waitress refilled couple times of hot tea for me. 

This meal is about $50. And we are still hungry seriously. Definitely overpriced and their food is below average quality.
author: Ari K.

description:
Despite reading a lot of negative reviews for restaurants in Japantown, we came here because it was the only restaurant that had no wait. It was 8:15pm on a long weekend Saturday. 

Food was ok, nothing special at all. We had an unagi roll and the teriyaki chicken. The salad dressing was really weird, it was watery with no taste. There were also a few flies buzzing around since the doors / windows were all open. 

If I had a choice and wasn't starving I would go out of Japantown for food.
author: Tony T.

description:
The service was fast and courteous 
The food good
Bathrooms need some graffiti removal
All in all
Worth going back again!
author: Sue F.

description:
So when I checked-in at this place saying "You can't go wrong with Japanese food", apparently you can  ironic yet it's the truth.

First off, the place was right next to Mifune so they definitely had some competition going on. It was cramped and small but not too shabby. Got a table right away and it was a full-house for dinner time as well. Our orders took a while though - bf got the rice curry and I got Nabeyaki Udon & Calpico. Waitress came back saying they ran out of Calpico! WHATTTT??? What is Udon without Calpico??? Sigh* 7-Up it was.

I'm sorry but if ur restaurant is in the middle of J-town then ur not allowed to run out of Calpico! Not to mention on the front cover of the menu it states "best Japanese Restaurant in Japan Town". Nahhh bro you ain't the best if you don't have Calpico!

Anyways enough about that lol we waited for like 20 mins for our entrees and the food was a big disappointment. Too much curry  with the rice so it made the rice super mushy (almost like porridge consistency). Udon was lacking flavors but I managed to finish it since I didn't wanna waste food but was still sad that we had to pay for this. My bf didn't even finish his curry!!! I mean that is saying something Cuz he ALWAYS finishes his food!!!! I repeat...ALLLLLWAYS!!!!

The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is cuz the staff were nice and it looked like they were trying to accommodate everyone, and it looked like they were short-staffed as well. But yea...definitely not the "best japanese restaurant in J-town".
author: Rose C.

description:
Am I ever going to find a decent Japantown restaurant? Feel like every place I try I'm striking out at, and I don't know how many outs I have left! Kushi Tsuru is yet another pass for me. 

Came here because of the relatively cheap bento boxes. And as per usual, you get what you pay for. I got some chicken katsu which was sliced super thin and flavorless, even with their katsu sauce. The best part of my bento was the California roll and that's so impossible to screw up that it won't win them any points. 

Service seemed very confused about their situation. As in they were a little slow with everything, including bringing us our check. We had someone refill our waters while we were clearly done with our meal, and 15 minutes later still no check. Eventually had to ask for it. 

Probably going to be another pass for me. Oh well, here's to my everlasting quest to find a decent Japantown restaurant!
author: Sean H.

description: We never got a chance to eat. Waited 20 minutes for a table for two at 3pm on a Saturday. Finally got sat, ordered two bento boxes and two cokes. 30 minutes after that still no lunch or cokes. Had to leave and eat hot dogs from the movie theater (ugh). No one even apologized or thanked us even after I left a tip (we had tea). Forget this place.
author: Alyssa J.

description: We typically eat at one of the "row" restaurants when we visit Japan town but we haven't eaten at this one as of yet.  Japan town was busier than usual because of the anime/cosplay festival.  Our wait was about 20 minutes which was decent considering the event.  It seemed a bit disorganized and we were re-seated to a larger table after our initial seating.  Despite that the service was decent, the food was good and plentiful (I had the Katsu Curry)  although it took some time to bring my daughters beef udon.   Will visit again.
author: Dean H.

description: Well, service is incredibly slow and they seemed to be staffed well enough... The food was alright me and my boyfriend both got Bento boxes with teriyaki chicken and in mine I got pot stickers and in his he got sashimi.  The chicken was pretty chewy and kind of dry.  The pot stickers were alright defiantly nothing special.  And he said the pieces of fish that he got were super thin for what he had ordered.  This restaurant is super tiny so I really don't know why service is so slow.  I wouldn't recommend it but I'm sure you could find something else in the mall that's better.  It also could age just been what we ordered though? Maybe the other stuff on the menu they do better??? Praying for this place because it's took over 25 min to get the Check and have it paid for.... I can't see any excuse for that
author: Elliott M.

description: You really can't beat the portions here. They give a pretty good amount, I always leave satisfied. The prices aren't the cheapest, but for quality Japanese food... it's not bad. It's very clean, free refillable tea, excellent service. I always get the salmon katsu. They respect the natural taste of salmon by not over seasoning it or putting unnecessary ingredients unlike other restaurants.
author: Marley B.

description: Honestly, I've had better Japanese food outside of Japantown and so I wasn't expecting much when I came here. We were in a group and they did split the bill up for us individually which was really great! But the two rolls my boyfriend and I shared fell apart too easily because the rice was too soft. They were just rather average rolls. Nothing very special about this place other than they do provide 2-hour parking validation! Which is actually the only reason that I went here. Might come again if I can't find another restaurant that offers parking validation.
author: Blaire A.

description:
Been eating here for a while but lately the food is not as what is used to be.

Rice was under cooked and the tempura dishes were a bit on the greasy side.

Had the combination shrimp tempura and salmon teriyaki bento. While presentation and amount of food were okay,  The soft shell crab appetizer was ok. Wait staff are friendly and attentive.

Still an ok place to go but need to improve on quality and taste ( a bit on the bland side).
author: Michael F.

description: It is in Japan Center. The environment is nice and the waiters are so kind. We ordered Kushi bento. I choose vegetable Tempura and Mackerel. I love the Tempura so much. There are fried carrot, broccoli, eggplants, sweet potato inside. And the sauce tastes really good.
author: Nancy S.

description: I ordered the kushi tsuru combo, a very simple plate with nigiri sushi, CA rolls, and miso soup. The cuts of fish we're generous and delicious, and the price is right at $20. This was a very no-nonsense, reasonable, and healthy lunch
author: Galen R.

description:
This is an OK Japanese restaurant in Japantown. I got the kitsune udon and the broth was pretty decent. The tofu pieces were fine. I also got a side salad and the sauce was a bit watered down. They also used iceberg lettuce which is not super.

The service is here is a bit strange. They seem aloof and they're not that attentive to you once your food is out. I don't think I got my water refilled once.
author: Danielle C.

description: They deserve 1 star only or zero if possible. We've been sitting for 3 minutes without anyone assisting us, had to wait for another 2 minutes for the waitress to get our orders. It was horrible customer service, waitresses don't smile or act like they didn't hear you. Always in a rush even if it wasn't busy. We were on our phones cause they took so long to bring the orders. Smelly cups, not clean enough. They didn't even give the check to us on the table that we had to go to cash register. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. NOT recommended.
author: Tina R.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out since we were in the area. I assumed being in Japan town that the sashimi would be good. However, it was only mediocre. This is what we ordered:

Dinner bento with sashimi and short ribs: sashimi wasn't too bad. Tuna wasn't as fresh but the salmon tasted fine. The short ribs had too much tendon that made it hard to chew and eat. Price: $11.95

Volcano roll (California baked with scallops): sweet and baked perfectly. Price: $12.95

Mango crunch: they forgot the crunch and when we told them, they took it back and just added the tempura flakes and gave it back to us with barely any flakes on it. The hamachi inside was not fresh at all and way too much avocado (unless you like that). Price: $13.95

Service: decent

Overall: it's alright. Might as well just drive somewhere else for better quality for the same price.
author: Linda N.

description:
If I could give this place a negative one star I would. A group of my friends and I stopped by to grab some quick dinner and decided to try this place out. The place was pretty quiet with ripped up booths and trash on the floor. Our server was insanely rude to me which was why I didn't have an appetite and decided not to eat. I asked her twice if I could please get straws but she didn't acknowledge nor reply so I assumed she couldn't hear me, which is why I asked her for straws the third time when she decided to say "Oh my
god I heard you ask 3 times already." My friends were very nice regardless, we were so uncomfortable after she decided to give us such bad attitude. Never recommending this place, obviously not ever coming back. A nice cherry on top was walking out and seeing a rat crawling around their Sapporo boxes.
author: Jasmine D.

description:
An average at best sushi place. 

The hot food was mostly bland, and the salmon sushi I ordered seemed like it had been frozen (it had that slightly pebbled texture, as opposed to a nice, smooth piece of fatty fish). 

Will probably be back because of the proximity, but... otherwise...
author: Allison S.

description: I've been here twice in the past month and I can honestly say that it's worth it. The menu is very simple and easy to understand. The food itself is great! The servers were great on checking up on us and making sure we had everything we needed. I really enjoyed my experience here and it's fairly on the cheaper side of the other restaurants in Japan Town. :)
author: Madi K.

description:
The star of our meal was the hamachi sashimi which was tender and flavorful. Everything else was good (rolls and more sashimi) but our visit was annoyingly cocked up by a miscommunication during our ordering process. Only the fancy rolls are on the menu (Dragon rolls etc) so if you want sashimi, nigiri or any of the simpler rolls (ie California roll), you need to order off menu. We wanted six pieces of sashimi (two each of tuna, hamachi and salmon) but instead, we got six pieces each of each fish for a total of 18 pieces! Rather than offering to take the fish back, the waitress apologized and said that it wasn't expensive and left it at that. Fortunately, we had enough people in our party to just about polish off the sashimi but they could have handled the mix up better, considering that there was no menu to work off of. 

Not the best sushi I've had but it was decent. However they need to fix their menu!

Also it's way too hot in the restaurant. Turn down the thermostat please!
author: Ada C.

description:
Solid.
Service = 5 stars
Prices = 5 stars
Food =  3 stars

Edamame - pass on it. Super over-cooked, mushy.
Cucumber Salad - great
Sashimi 9 piece - fresh, sizable pieces
49er Roll - great
Fiery Island - eh
Roll w/Pickle - good (it's pickled daikon)
Teriyaki Chicken - good flavor, made with thigh meat (slightly chewy). I wouldn't order again. 
Veg Tempura - good
author: Amy O.

description:
We came here after a spa day. 

We each ordered a side salad, miso soup, and one rolls each.

I got the caterpillar roll. I don't remember what my friend got. But I tried both, and they were by far some of the best quality sushi I've had in a long time. The salad had delicious dressing and the miso soup was average.

Good service, reasonable prices. Good sushi spot in japan town.
author: Melanie P.

description:
After a year we revisited day after New Year's.  

They renewed the restaurant a bit:  New faux wooden flooring & the shared toilets have gotten a needed repaint as well as new sinks, faucets, and toilets.  Finally.

The food seemed to be better quality than before (e.g. teriyaki chicken was not gristly and tasted very fresh).  Also there are two new (at least to us) servers who definitely were efficient and friendly; they were quick to refill our green tea when we requested & accommodated our request for extra wasabi/ginger.
author: Luisa T.

description: This place is mediocre, at best. We ordered the Morgan Hill roll and a chicken katsu entrée. The katsu came out promptly and tasted just like any other katsu. The roll, however, took about 20 minutes to come out to us, which at that time 2 couples who were seated/ordered after us had received their meals before our single roll arrived at our table. Excited to finally start eating, the shrimp tempura in the roll was cold and soggy. The waitress was also nowhere to be found that we just decided to leave. Will  not be coming back here again.
author: Rosslyn T.

description: My friends and I were starving; it was past 3 pm and we didn't have food all morning. We decided to eat at Kushi Tsuru and had to wait to get seated since most of the tables and booths couldn't fit all 6 of us. After everyone got their orders, I was still waiting for my Teriyaki rice plate (very basic). The server said it was taking a while, but clearly they left out my order because she asked if everyone already got their plates. I ended up getting my food a lot later than everyone else (they were almost done with their food) and the taste was very basic. However, she gave me a can of soda on the house for the delay.
author: Joanne H.

description: I'm surprised by all the negative reviews. We really enjoyed our food here. Bo had the beef teriyaki bento box and the meat was super tender. We also tried the "monkey brains" appetizer. No its not really monkey brains. And we also had the sashimi tacos. It was all delicious. Will definitely be back!
author: Angelene H.

description: I first discovered Kushi Tsuru when I came to the annual Japantown Cherry Blossom Festival. I came back because of lack of options of genuine Japanese food in that area, according to my two chinese friends I was with. They claim that a lot of the food in the area we were in is Americanized so we decided to go with what I was already familiar with - Kushi Tsuru. I enjoyed the first and I enjoyed it this time. My friends and I all went with Ramen. My wife went with two sushi rolls. I believe this place is legit because my two chinese friends who know a lot about asian cuisine thought it was pretty good. They also taught me that you usually don't eat a dish with rice (sushi) and a dish with noodles (ramen) together. The service was also great. I think I'll be back during the next cherry blossom festival.
author: Sergio C.

description: Been coming here for years and it's one of my go-to places for a quick lunch when I visit SF Japantown.  The restaurant is fairly small and can get pretty crowded.  Their bento boxes are always a good choice,  I like their California Bento which comes with chicken teriyaki, Maguro sashimi, deep fried fish and a couple of pieces of California rolls.  Can't argue with a $10 bento box.  I also enjoy their donburi and ramen/soba dishes too.  The food is solid and the service is always good.
author: Lon H.

description: Nice venue very relaxing. I got their bento box with sashimi and chicken katsu. Their sashimi wasn't all that great and the katsu seemed a little too over cooked
author: Richard P.

description:
It seems like every restaurant in Japan Town has 3 stars on Yelp. 

I enjoyed what we ordered: sashimi and sukiyaki. 

Sashimi was fresh. Sukiyaki tasty. M complained because she wanted her sukiyaki a bit more raw and cooked tableside. I don't think that was an option here. 

No complaints from me!
author: Elsie W.

description:
Great food. The broth for the Nabeyaki Udon is perfect. Miso soup is heavenly. For sushi, we had the screaming orgasm, hamachi  roll, lobster roll and tempura appetizer. Everything had a wonderful, tantalizing flavor. 

The restaurant is small and clean, once it gets busy it may get a bit warmer, due to the amount of people. 

The wait staff was very friendly, accommodating, always on the ready with hot tea and water. When plates were empty they didn't sit at the table, they were cleared at a reasonable time. 


Definitely a place to dine at if in Japantown. Wonderful experience and pleasant atmosphere. Food is absolutely divine.
author: Melanie P.

description: Yes the napkins are reused but easily rectified. Just ask for new ones. The bento box is very generous with grilled chicken, salad, rice, miso soup, ca roll (2), and salmon sashimi (3)...all for $10! Hubby had the sashimi lunch and the kids had the miso ramen (very big bowl). The free coke was a nice freebie but so is the green tea. On top of it, the service was wonderful!!!
author: Jackie L.

description: Good food for the price. Service was a little spotty. Had to ask for utensils and kind of forgot about us when it came time to pay.
author: Janine K.

description: I have been long overdue in writing this review. I have eaten here many times, and I am always very happy with the fast service and the high quality of the sushi. Plus I love the environment.
author: Christopher E.

description: Waitress cut me off twice when I tried to ask a question because she assumed she knew what I was about to ask. We ordered udon and they brought us something else. Waitress said it was our mistake but she had clearly heard wrong because we didn't even know what that other bowl was called. We told her to cancel the order completely, but they brought us the udon anyway and charged us for it. All in all, service was terrible. Food was ok.
author: Shelly N.

description: This is My favorite place to eat Katsu curry.. The serving is huge, 2 people can be full with one order.. However. Don't order it for to go. The serving for a to go is so small.
author: Palquinn Anthony K.

description: Another of the Japantown plaza restaurants where one ends up, rather than goes there by choice. Arrived on a Tuesday at 2 PM, mostly deserted, and service was still slow, but at least they bring you a whole bottle of water to drink while waiting for things to arrive. They do have sriracha available if you ask. Overall, the sushi quality was serviceable, and the ramen was decently priced and a good portion, but fairly basic. The jalapeno bombs are edible but not outstanding. Try not to get seated in the back, seems to be the best recommendation if you don't want to get forgotten.
author: Bryan T.

description:
Blech.

We tried this place as it looked appealing since there was a line of people waiting to dine here. I ordered the Udon with tempura, it was super bland, I only took 3 bites. My friend ordered the the beef udon and she didn't enjoy it either. My hubby ordered beef teriyaki and got nothing but fat. The kids had chicken katsu that was burnt. The cups they gave us for water were just miscellaneous coffee cups with no ice! The restaurant itself was already pretty warm and muggy in there. 

The icing on the cake was when I was walking to the restroom, there was a huge pregnant roach crawling on the wall! DO NOT GO HERE!
author: Nancy G.

description: The bento box portions are so small that it's probably meant for a toddler to eat. The service was forgettable and overall, not recommended if you want a good place to eat. Can't even say it's mediocre since I'm so disappointed. Just keep walking no matter how hungry you are, it's probably worth the wait to go somewhere else.
author: Noemi T.

description: Have not been to Japan Town in years. Made plans to meet friend there Labor Day.  Got there before most of the shops were open but I really like Japantown the shops are for tourist but so is SF anyway. We checked a few places but Kushi Tsuru caught our attention.  We were so happy with our choice. The Unagi was like butter, we both got Bento Boxes I ate everything! I am known for never eating everything. And every time we looked up there was a line outside and I know why.  The food is awesome!
author: Karolyn H.

description: Stopped in for a simple oyako don. It was horrible. First of all the sauce it was simmered in was strange tasting, not typical. Secondly, it was oyako soup not oyako don. The strange sauce was completely soaking the entire bowl of rice underneath, not how you serve this dish. Since it did not taste good at all it completely spoiled the dish. Also they used asparagus in it, although I like asparagus it is a strange thing to put in this dish. The chicken was completely rubbery and tasteless. The service was very slow. This place must have changed hands, I don't remember it ever being this bad.
author: Anna H.

description:
I check with yelp everytime I try a new place...except this time.  

I was starving, the display looked good and I wanted to eat kushiage.

Ordered kushi bento & california bento.

Kushi bento ($10.00): kushiage (mushroom, zucchini and imitation crab), agedashi tofu, grilled eel, served with miso soup and rice.  It wasn't good.
California bento ($10.00): grilled chicken teriyaki, tuna sashimi, deep fried fish, california roll 2 pcs, salad with miso soup and rice.  The chicken teriyaki was surprisingly not too bad.

The miso soup tasted ok but too watered down and had no tofu.

Located @ Japan Center West, Kushi Tsuru validates your parking for $2 parking discount.  At least this place has great customer service.

2.5 stars!!

Kushi Tsuru is not yummylicious!!

QUICK TIP: YOUR CHOICE OF FREE SODA WITH CHECK IN
author: Maggie C.

description: The food was decent, nothing special. Service was a bit slow, probably because there were proportionately too many customers to the amount of staff.
author: Tommy Z.

description:
I think basically I wouldn't come back to this place -- at least for dinner. I ordered the three combo dinner: Saba, sashimi and California roll. Saba was a bit fishy than most and very oily. Sashimi was ok but nothing to cheer about (ate two pieces out of 6) and the rice on the California roll was hard. I guess one good thing about the food is that it's made less salty so it's healthier.

One of our plates came without ginger and it seems like our neighboring customers also were missing wasabi and ginger with their sushi and rolls.

The bigger issue is service. They barely come around so I had to walk over and get them and let them know there's also other guests who need them.

Basically I wouldn't come here. There's not much value here for what you pay.
author: Sarah K.

description: Customer service and food is good but a little oily for me. Other than that everything is okay. The ambience is also nice.
author: Den F.

description: To be honest, this was surprisingly good. Now, one of the waitresses is far from nice. However, the food is rather tasty. Tried the udon and bento boxes with teriyaki chicken. Came out in a timely manner. The portions was more than expected and really filled me up. Would come here again
author: Allen W.

description: We had tempura and kastu lunch bento boxs. The tempera was not batter with the right batter and when u bite into it your mouth fills with oil. It was very heavy and tempers is suppose to be light. The California rolls fell apart at first grab. Kastu was fatty with little meat. We saw a large cockroach on the wall and when we told the  waitress she just said it came from next door . She did not attempt to kill it or apologize for it.  No offer of a discount or anything. If u want fast but bad service and crappy "Japanese" food and also eat with the company of cockroaches then u should eat here.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Walking into here, my first time here not only to the restaurant but to J-Town as well, I am excited! (Although I've learned by past experiences to never have high hopes, I wasn't expecting too much.) Being on a budget, I choose a moderate priced item (the beef teriyaki lunch special priced around $9 but was supposed to come with miso soup so I figured it was alright) the portions were small, my friend's smaller and more expensive despite being the chicken version of my plate, and my first bite was my least favorite part of the meat, the fat. Overlooking that little detail that I assure myself is just like life and sometimes you gotta deal with the fat, I went on to the rest of the meal, asking my friends about how the miso soup is usually supposed to come first. I then witnessed our neighboring tables being served soup after their meals and assumed that ours would come soon after. 

After waiting for my friend's soda, thank god I got water or I would have been edgy and I'm not pretty when I'm edgy, we asked one of the ladies who were cleaning our table if we had miso soup coming and she explained that she just got there and didn't know. She asked if we still wanted it and we replied yes if we are still getting charged for it. The soda comes with an extremely apologetic lady who asks if we still want it and then tried to walk away with it... After we said we wanted it......... So more waiting in that super hot coup and no soup. She brings a check and tells us to take our time, assuming she was still bringing us our soup. 

We check the check in case they happened to not charge is for our soup that came with the lunch special... All of the items had an (L) for lunch special. It had been nearly 2 hours and I was really not about to stay. We get up to leave and tell the man that we didn't receive our soup and gave me the most rudest "tough shit" expression and said he can still give it to us but he couldn't subtract it. I told him we couldn't stay, implying at least a take out. He just said he'd take it out of the tip. 

What. The. Hell. 1) are you auto-tipping yourself with four people or 2) are you insinuating I was going to tip you for your crappy service? You should have paid me. I asked him again if he could just take something off and he refused. So not only was I forced to pay for soup I did not receive, I was given the most rudest experience. 

Great first impression of J-Town: the restaurants steal and expect you to tip. The least they could have done is subtract the soda! In the least!
author: Mimi M.

description:
My family and I have been going to Japantown for years, but I did not try Kushi Tsuru until the cherry blossom festival 2 years ago. Walking around and exploring Japantown can sure work up an appetite, so we decided to try this restaurant out since it had the shortest wait time and they weren't as expensive as Benihana. We waited about 10 minutes after we put our name down on the list to wait for a table. Despite being a fairly small restaurant, they had a rather extensive menu. Shortly after we were seated, our waiter greeted us and took our drink and meal orders. She was very friendly and attentive to our needs (we didn't have to ask her for refills on our drinks at all because she would notice on her own BEFORE our glasses were empty). We didn't have to wait long for our food to be brought out to us, despite the restaurant being very busy. Although it came out quickly, the food was very delicious and well prepared, which is one of the reasons why I keep stopping by to dine here whenever I'm in the area.
All of the hosts and waiters that I've encountered each time I've came here are very friendly, helpful, and attentive (even when the restaurant is very busy). The food is great (not as amazing as some of the food I had in Japan, obviously), but it's a little more on the pricey side, which is to be expected since it is in Japantown (aka tourist spot).
author: Paulamertha A.

description:
Nice little find in Japantown. Not as expensive as it looks. The service was top notch, the decor was tasteful, and the lunch special was a steal. 

Definitely worth checking out of you're in the area, especially things can get pricey if you don't watch it.
author: Jonathan H.

description: So I and my girlfriend was really hungry wanted Japanese food, so we decided to eat at this place and it was okay. Why "okay" I say? It's because the seaweed salad made up for my meal it was the seaweed salad with spicy tuna it was really good for $4.00! So what I ate was chicken with egg and rice. So imagine eating water down rice with really chewy chicken and bland eggs. The chicken tasted old like a fishy taste, the rice was soft and mushy not my cup of tea. Now the eggs, eggs are dedicate foods because they burn easy. (My opinion) I had good Japanese food and having high expectation for quality food coming from japantown it would be good. Overall this place is okay, customer service is good and they give you green tea.
author: Rendell S.

description:
Good solid Japanese restaurant. Went here after being ignored at Mifune. We were seated right away and the server quickly brought tea, water and miso soup before we even ordered.  She took our orders and quickly brought my son some rice for his soup.  Lunches came out within 10 minutes. The food was reasonably priced, too. 

I'd come back if I was in the area again.
author: Bruges L.

description:
Cute restaurant in Japantown!  We actually picked it by random and were pleasantly surprised.  Service is excellent here.  

Ordered the chirashi bento which included miso soup, shrimp skewers (shrimp, onion, zucchini), and a deep fried filet of halibut.  The chirashi was split into two bowls-- one with the raw fish and the other with the tamago, ebi, and imitation crab sticks.  

Also ordered the 6 piece fried gyoza appetizer-- very flaky and crispy on the outside, but the inside was very "bread-y".  Forget what type of meat was supposed to be inside.

I think what's most popular here is their bento boxes and ramen, not so much the sushi.

PS: if you check in on yelp, you get 1 free soda (Monday- Thursday, between 11:30am - 9:00 pm, with a bill of $15 or more).  LOL.
author: Christina G.

description:
After walking up and down restaurant row several times, we ended up going here. 

Really can't go wrong with getting Japanese food in Japantown. Bento box was good, nothing special - sashimi tasted fresh, and the tempura was tasty. Miso soup was on point. Service however could've used a little work. I get it's the lunch time and you're waiting for the lunch hour rush, but let's focus on the dining customers you have now, rather than the ones potentially coming in later. 


All in all, for its location and prices, it was good, and we left satisfied, so that is all that's important.
author: Laurens D.

description: Food I'd give a 3/5. They claim to be the best Japanese restaurant in japantown. The rolls had mushy warm tuna in them, the service is terrible and so slow. They don't give you the time of day and unfriendly. The food came out somewhat quick but was just okay. Pretty good chicken katsu though. If you're looking for a last resort. Here you go.
author: Nicole S.

description: Basic basic sushi. Nothing special, order three rolls and it came out really small for the price. Also the rolls literally had only 3 ingredients. Save your money for anything else. Waiter was nice to give miso soup on the house. Also the wait here seemed long since it is a small restaurant and okay service.
author: Cindy T.

description: will not recommend this place to friends or anyone.. sashimi not fresh, I'm giving it a 1 coz there's no 1/2 a star review... oh and yeah long wait service, sorry but I've to let others know
author: Neng G.

description: Been to this place like 4 times or so.  Not bad, but not really great either.  Average prices, portions are small, at least for my Sukiyaki.  Service was just average.  Tasty in some dishes, but it's not a place I'll brag about.
author: Betty Y.

description:
Not a bad place for an impromptu lunch.  Arrived here after the noon crowd and was seated promptly.  I like that their lunch special offerings were varied enough.  You get to choose between a selection of bento, donburi, curries, or udon.  Or you could skip that and try some sushi rolls.  I opted for the Katsu Don and my lunch buddy ordered a hamachi roll.  My donburi arrived piping hot, with the pork cutlet sliced into five pieces and topped with a slightly sweet, creamy sauce.  Below the cutlet was a scrambled egg with onions atop a healthy portion of brown rice.  Everything was seasoned well, but the cutlet lost its crispiness because of the sauce.  Flavor-wise it was okay.  I did enjoy the egg and rice.  I couldn't tell exactly what they added to the onions but it made them taste good.  Perhaps it was mirin?  That's just a guess.  Still, I liked it.

As for the hamachi roll that my lunch buddy ordered?  He said it was also just okay.

I've read other reviews lamenting the service, but I found ours to be acceptable.  The waitresses seemed busy, although three of them found their way to our table to make sure our glasses were topped off with water and our plates cleared when we were finished with our meals.  We didn't have to ask for the check.  They handed it to us right after they cleared our table.

All in all, I would rate this about the same as the restaurant next door, which I've dined in three times and found it equally average.  I would go back and maybe try their udon.  The choices are more the traditional style and I'm curious how their Nabeyaki Udon would compare to one I had at a different restaurant.
author: Eileen P.

description:
By far the worst Chicken Kaarage I've ever had.  First, the meat was in pieces like scrapes...presentation was horrible.   Its obvivous they use the leftover meat pieces becuase there were dime size pieces.  Second, its been under a heating lamp because it was not hot.  Thrid, the Chicken Karaage was salty.

BTW...it was the combo plate I had.  The restaurant was half empty and it still took a ling time for the food to arrive...considering they didnt havr to fry the chicken.  No wonder most of the restaurants in J town is rated 3 or less.

Million dollar question...woukd I go back?  NO WAY!!!!!
author: MickYee M.

description: Really loved the mouchi.  I loved the shit out of the udon noodles. The meat was great.  And the overall atmosphere was fantastic.
author: Josh L.

description: I've been going here for so many years but tonight was my last visit. The service was nonexistent, there was hair in my water, and it took us 45 minutes to be served. Perhaps this place is under new management, but it has certainly taken a turn for the worst in the past couple of months. No need to eat here when there are a ton of other Japanese restaurants surrounding this one.
author: Marie B.

description: This is a pretty good Japanese restaurant in the Japantown mall. Everything is good and sushi seems fresh.
author: Peter K.

description: This place is really easy to pass by without noticing. If only I was so lucky. Stopped in here for lunch today with my boyfriend. When we walked in, we noticed the place was very small and dirty, but figured sometimes the best restaurants don't necessarily look like it. This was not one of those restaurants. It took about five minutes before someone came to acknowledge we were there, and another couple of minutes to seat us (despite numerous tables being open). Once we were sat it took another ten minutes before someone came to take our order. We both ordered bento boxes, mine with Shashimi and Chicken Teriyaki. Bento Boxes come with two pieces of a California roll, miso soup, salad, and rice. We never got our miso soup and had to ask for it. The chicken was chewy and dry (like eating really bad jerky), and the Shashimi were the smallest cuts of fish I've ever seen from a sushi restaurant. The price (10.50) wasn't bad compared to other restaurants in the Japan Town mall, but honestly, I would've rather payed more somewhere else. Once we ate, it took over fifteen minutes to get the check and had to ask for it twice, and then another fifteen minutes to run our cards. Not coming back.
author: Ryan F.

description: No idea what the bad reviews are about.. I had dinner here and both portions were huge!   In fact we hardly finished them.  Also.. The orders were ready in less than ten minutes.  Overall happy with the place!
author: A F.

description:
All the past reviewers comments about small portions and MEH service is true. No value for the price you pay for. Same goes for the Shrimp Tempura.

Overpriced $20 Bento Box meals. We came in on a weeknight, the food took about 30 min to arrive, there were 5 of us. YET, they still charged %18 gratuity. On a group of 5. FIVE!

Usually thats on groups larger than 6 dear. Besides that, the food was very mediocre.
When you order a $20 Bento box, you expect to be full. We all ordered a main meat dish on our boxes, and I kid you not, it was the size of a Happy Meal.

No wait, Happy Meals portions are larger. This was SMALLER PORTIONS than that. 
Like a quarter of a normal sized chicken breast. That was the portion.
You can tell they skimped portion size on everything. Even the friggin salad.

The decor is drab too.

On top of which we ordered rolls to help with the tiny portions.

TASTE -- Meh. I've had better. The Screaming Orgasm roll, nothing flavorful really.
Only thing halfway decent was the Rainbow roll and Lion King roll. 

SERVICE -- Average.

Never coming back, go to Benihana across the way instead.
Go by the old adage, if its dead inside, there's a reason for lack of customers, only go to places that have a steady flow of customers.
author: Sammy L.

description:
I hate to be THAT guy, but if you want to eat Japanese food, go to a place where the people are from Japan.  That is not the case here, and the food always gives it away.  It LOOKS like Japanese food, but doesn't taste anything like it -- miso way too salty, curry too sweet and oily, tempura batter too heavy and too sweet.  

Also, if you're gonna open a   "Japanese" restaurant, you should at a bare minimum use Japanese rice, even if you personally think your own country's rice is better.

Now, please excuse me, but I'm working on the business plan for this Ethiopian restaurant I want to open in Tiburon.
author: Mark P.

description:
My 1st Japaneses and sf review!

So I came here and this place seems inserting on the outside, and I was suppressed why is there no Japaneses on the menu. This alerts me. I sat down and the seating is ok and it's worst than those Hong Kong with British food places in Chinatown. The menu is easy to read and we ordered. The waitress was polite, and we were given Miso soup. It was very bitter. The texture was off but it's still better than powder tea. They gave us our order and it was tasty. The dragon roll looked exactly the same in the menu as the food. Overall pretty good experience. It's bit on the pricey side.

Pros:
flavor (escically strong flavors)
Dosen't give you stomach problems
nice waiters
service
no tv
quiet

Cons:
Miso soup was too strong
Where's Japaneses text
Fans (such a Chinatown dim sum place poser)
dirtyish
author: Simon C.

description:
The free soda promotion is literally a free soda =( I wanted a calpico and they only offered a sprite or pepsi. no bueno. =( 

the food was okay. i thought it was a little on the pricey side but on a busy saturday night, this place seated us within 5 minutes. that's a plus!
author: Annie Z.

description: Ate lunch here in Japan Town. Lunch bento box two items with soup and tea $9.99 + tax. Food was good and service also good. Eating more Japanese dishes with fish items to lower cholesteral. Parking validation for garage downstairs for one hour. Smaller restaurant compared to others on this restaurant row.
author: Clifford W.

description:
The Bro bought me here as it's the only place he goes to eat ramen in Japan Town.

Pros:
- slightly greasy but yummy croquette
- california rolls were pretty decent
- salmon teriyaki was very thin.

Cons:
- LONGGGGGGG WAIT FOR FOOD.  And it wasn't just our table.
- wait staff was overwhelmed and we were ignored most of the time.  It would have been very easy to dine and dash.
- They gave us a wrong order for udon noodles TWICE.  After the second time we just accepted it.
- baked sushi wasn't up to par
- no more ramen
- pricey for what we got.

Looked up on Yelp later and found out they changed owners (rumor has it they're not even Japanese).  

They're hiring now for servers, sushi cooks, kitchen staff.  Not a good sign.
author: Walerz B.

description: Sushi was good, but service is not good. Waited nearly an hour for our two sushi rolls while three other parties after us got their food BEFORE us. Given little attention or empathy for our late food. Not coming back during a busy day.
author: Dominique V.

description: Decided to drop by for lunch after a bike trip around the golden gate park. This is a really small Japanese restaurant with one server/waiter. Now I decided to get the bento box with gyoza and chicken katsu, which also comes along with rice, salad, and miso soup. For the price your paying, it's a pretty good portion. The food was pretty standard. And the service was really great for just once person running it. I'd like to come back but there's also so many other Japanese restaurant in japantown that I also want to go to.
author: Russell V.

description:
The food here is amazing! This is as close as you can get to eating authentic Japanese food. We all left feeling very satisfied. 

Food ordered:
Wakami miso soup
Bento box
Lion King

Definitely will return.
author: M M.

description: Came with my boyfriend on our trip to San Francisco, we both loved it. Good food at a reasonable price.
author: Maria C.

description:
So we walked around, looked at all the 3d dishes of the actual menu items all over Japan Town. We ended up here Kushi

We are giving it 3 star for the food and the service. Be careful if you are the type of people don't like salty dishes because it was very salty for us. 

There are probably equivalent places around so feel venturesome over the other places before you sit down here. 

Getting attention for the check was also a challenge for us. Cheers!
author: Neo N.

description: Great customer service. I walked in, hella hungry, and they were ready to serve me right away. The miso soup came out instantly, and it was absolutely delicious. I ordered the dinner bento box with the salmon teriyaki and beef teriyaki. It was fantastic. The salmon was cooked perfectly, and the beef was mouth watering.
author: Mitchell L.

description: Came here for a quick bite with the boyfriend, but was not impressed with our food. I had the beef donburi, which was nothing special and his bento box was nothing special. I would give it one star, but their food wasn't appalling. The service was what brought their stars down - they took forever to take our order, forgot our utensils & water (which we had to ask for when our food was served -___-), and our waitresses look like they did not want to be there. It didn't feel welcoming or comfortable for us to eat there either. Won't be back.
author: Amanda C.

description:
This place isn't worth it. A group of us got there with a whole group of people in front of us. The host says the wait is 15 mins. I look around and know that the wait is well over 15 mins. The whole time we waited, he was telling every person the  wait was 15 mins. 

Ok, we finally get seated and order. I got the chicken karaage curry ($9.50)... this dish was ok. The chicken karaage didn't have much flavor like other chicken karaage dishes I have had at other places and the curry isn't all that good. Overall, everything was just ok.

My friend didn't get his dish cause the server thought he was sharing (even though he said 2 orders of the chirashi bento ($15).  

Another person ordered the 2 item combo deal ($12.50) and the beef dish he picked had more onions than meat.

We did ask for water, the lady came with 3 glasses and said we had to wait for more cups of water till later cause they ran of glasses. hrm... weird.

Service was ok.... food was meh.
author: Erica T.

description:
Under new management. Place ain't the same :(

Overcooked soba, meh gyoza... it's too bad things changed.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I write this review with a heavy heart. Kushi Tsuru has been my go to location for authentic Japanese sushi for years. It's one of the last real Japanese sushi joints in Japantown as ironically, most are no longer real Japanese owned/operated. 

I came here Saturday with the GF and her friend and noticed something was off when we got our usual Pink Lady. It's supposed to come covered with a variety of sashimi but instead, appeared to be just tuna. Next came our Chirashi bowls which ironically took longer than the cooked entree our friend ordered. The bowl was noticeably larger with the pieces of fish cut wrong and VERY large in size. I'm all for huge portions but you know the quality is usually going to suffer. Sure enough, it was fishy and tasted like it had just been quick defrosted.

As we left, we noticed a large yellow sign notifying the public of a change in ownership. It's been taken over by a new owner and the changes clearly show in the food. A quick search informed us the new owners were not Japanese which the food clearly had already informed us. 

Bottom Line: If you like lower quality food but huge portions, go here. We'll have to stick to San Mateo for our authentic sushi needs.
author: Mike H.

description:
Even by my low, low Japantown expectations, this place was awful. 

My boyfriend and I came here out of sheer desperate hunger and after perusing the menu, decided ramen was the thing to try. We ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen and the Shoyu Ramen, which for any Japanese restaurant, is Basis Ramen 101. Yet Kushi still managed to screw them up.

My Tonkatsu Ramen arrived swimming in pools of grease. Circles of yellow oil literally floated atop the cream-colored broth. Am I painting a gross enough picture for you? I don't even understand how there could be that much oil in a tonkatsu--I mean, did they stir-fry the bamboo shoots in bacon fat? The broth, which is the heart of any bowl of ramen, was salt overload with no other flavor. Ugh! The Shoyu was even worse: bland and flavorless, which I suppose is quite a remarkable feat considering the broth is supposed to be made of soy sauce. No other flavors in the broth and my boyfriend received all of one piece of pork. 

Service was awful and the staff all wear these kitschy harajuku/faux-kimono outfits that make you feel really awkward and uncomfortable. Or maybe that's just me. I always feel awkward and uncomfortable around people who purposely choose to look like stereotypes.
author: Josephine L.

description: Arrived here on a hungry Sunday afternoon, it was fairly busy but not busy enough to have to wait for a table so my table of four were immediately seated. It was a nice day in the bay;however, from the time of arrival to exiting I was dripping in sweat. Mind you, I had a tank top on. We were seated at a corner wall right next to the kitchen and either the a/c did not work or they opted to not turn it on. There was a standing fan that was turn on but faced opposite from my table so there were absolutely no air. tremendous torture! Humid. I ordered a lunch special bento box !10.xx for thee hubs to share with my little child and I ordered a $13.xx udon noodle. Let's say the udon noodle tasted similar to the packaged ones that are sold at the Asian supermarkets except with extra fixes. I ate half and I was done. Service was poor, no one came around for water refills . If anything was needed we had to call someone over with a point finger. If you sit and wait you're just wasting time, gotta just call em over and give it to them. First and last.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Positive:
* Cute restaurant, friendly staff, moderate prices, extensive menu, and complimentary green tea.

I tried the Veggie Bento Box (Cold buckwheat noodles, dipping sauce (fish stock), 
agedashi tofu, kappa maki 6pcs, served with salad- $10) and my boyfriend had the 49er Roll (Crab salad, cucumber, avocado topped with salmon, yellow tail, lemon, tobiko roe and Kushi Tsuru sauce - $13) -- both were good. I loved the edamame ($3.25), it was salty and warm. Aside from the restrooms being a little scary/dingy, I'd return.
author: Jennae H.

description:
They used to have a very good dish and sushi rolls selection, but not anymore.
I think they're under new management now. Now they serve mediocre over priced food. Even the service became worse.
The good thing about this place only the tea and miso soup. Nothing more.
author: Nelly T.

description:
The food took forever to come out (30 mins+). And I am talking about just their regular dinner set. Quality of the food was below average, their shrimp in the shrimp tempura was actually a little cold and the it was not crispy (that's a first for me, cold shrimp tempura). Pork cutlet was overcooked to the point where it was burnt and had no taste at all. 

Go somewhere else instead.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: If i could give less then one star i so would. This is literally the worst experience ive ever had at a restraunt. First we waited over thirty minutes for our food. Then before we even got our food they put our check on the table and expected us to pay. Then they gave us dirty plates. I found a hair in my food. Whatever. It was just on the side of the plate. But still disgusting. They  never once checked on our drinks. Then while im eating i had a bug crawl up my arm that looked terrifyingly like a cockaroach but i wasnt gonna let it sit on me long enough to find out exactly what it was. When we told them about the bug they said it came from outeside... ?!?!? Were dead center in japantowns mall thing whatever its called. Indoors.  I repeat inside of a mall. Wtf.
author: Marissa H.

description:
Was by myself, ordered one roll and a beer. 2 minutes later a couple sits next to me and orders chicken Katsu don, and an eel bowl. They both get served 4 minutes before I get my one roll. 

A bit disappointing that I didn't get my food before other who ordered after me.
author: Carter C.

description: They skipped over us twice, we were very hungry. They took a long time to get our order, they also took a long time to give us the bill, and they added 18% tip for themselves. Even though the food was good, I'm never eating there again.
author: Marissa B.

description: Good food but not anything exceptionally special. GREAT customer service though, I had the nicest lady as my server. Overall atmosphere of the restaurant was a bit dull though. Prices were pretty average, most dishes were between $10-$12.
author: Kilana F.

description: Came here after being disappointed by the Sushi boat restaurant in the mall.. we were greeted, seated promptly and served tea in an instant.. I really enjoyed the service and ambiance of this place. The food wasn't overpriced either and there was a good selection. We weren't too hungry considering we had a few pieces of sushi prior... so we just ordered a bowl of rice, chicken karage and a salad. Everything was tasty and we were pleased overall. They also offer an hour of validation for the parking lot.
author: Tiff C.

description: I ordered sushi and my family had bento boxes. Just say, I was watching them eat... When they were done, they were watching me eat. My food was 45 minutes late, and my sushi was dry..... Also, no A/C, so it was super hot, smelly, and hungry...
author: Stephen E.

description:
Either my standards have lowered, or I was really, really hungry, because this place isn't entirely as awful as a lot of Yelpers make it out to be.

Greg G. and I were in search of ramen and ended up at Kushi Tsuru.  When we walked in, we were the only ones in the restaurant at 7:30 on a Thursday.  However, 15 minutes later, the entire restaurant had filled up.  Weird.

I opted for the tonkatsu ramen (around $9) and was pleasantly surprised by how good it actually tasted.  The noodles tasted pretty fresh, but the broth was a bit too salty, albeit flavorful.  My other gripe is that there should've been an option to add more chashu, because it only came with one measly piece.

3.5 stars rounded down for the reasons above.
author: Tori S.

description:
Came in on a Saturday night, and tried to avoid the lines at the restaurants next door.  This place was filling up as well, so we grabbed a booth for 6 of us before we were out of luck.  

Cool bentos...  I had the Chirashi Gozen Bento, which came with sashimi laid out on top of a small bowl of sushi rice and tobiko, a mini bowl of chirashi, two small beef robata skewers, a deep fried filet of halibut, and a small dessert dish of coconut jelly, and red bean.

My wife and kids had bentos, and a few rolls, and other donburi bowls seemed OK as well.  Nothing really seemed to wow me, but food is fairly decent.
author: Lawrence L.

description: Morgan Hill roll was yummy, friendly service and food came fast. Not amazing but fair quality
author: Ashlei T.

description: Well the sushi was tasty, poorly rolled hand rolls, they forgot the sake and miso soup. The service was very slow, and almost non existent.
author: Victoria N.

description: Service wasn't the best. We didn't get any utensils... Food was ok. Small place compared to some of the other restaurant available there. Small bathroom but at least they have one ... Katsu chicken was made with dark meat. Didn't like that. Short rib in the bento box wasn't that good. Portion of rice was small .... Got no refill on water
author: L M.

description:
This place is located in the heart of the Tokyo Town mall along a row of other Japanese places. I figured they would all be about the same so I chose this place at random. 

We ordered several dishes to share, one of which we hated. I asked the server if we could send it back and she said no. I asked for a manager and they said there was no manager. 

I later spoke to a middle aged to older asian man who claimed to be the manager. I asked him if I could send this item back, it didn't cost much, we hadn't eaten it, we didn't like it. 

What he said really surprised me, in a nice kind tone he said We dont take food back because of black people. I was surprised, I'm also asian so he probably thought that was ok to say to me but its not. It was extremely racist, what already seemed like an unfair policy just became a racist unfair policy. 

Not much more to say.
author: Luca C.

description: Loved this restaurant.  Started our meal with a very tasty Miso soup, vegetable shrimp tempura and an assortment of sushi.  There were six of us at the table.  We all had Nabeyaki Udon.  The broth was very tasty.  Noodles were perfect. The restaurant itself was clean  and service was great.  Haven't tried other things on the menu but when we left, there were many older locals there having there dinners.  When you don't know what restaurants to go to, just check out where you see the locals gather.  Visiting here from Maui.  Would love to come back and try the rest on the menu like there bento plates.  Buy the way the price of the meal was reasonable.
author: Mary Ann P.

description:
My sister and I couldn't figure out what to have for dinner so we decided to drive to Japantown to browse and see what was still open. 

We had so many Japanese restaurants to choose from but we decided on this spot just bc I wanted to yelp about them later so here we go.. 

*A free soda if you use your yelp check in!! 
Yep that's right folks, free soda upon checking in. 
We were escorted to our seats and handed our menus by our friendly and sweet waitress. She was attentive and checking in with us when as well as assisting the other patrons so kudos to her on multitasking. 

My sister decided on chicken karaje curry over rice *she's a chicken lover!!* and I went with their combonation of Salmon Teriyaki and Salmon Sashimi. *Bc I love my fishy!!*

- The chicken karaje over curry was curryrific!! Flavorful, with carrots, tender chicken pieces and topped with pickled tomato pieces over rice. *LOVED the pickled tomato pieces, it was unique and something we never tried before*

- Salmon Teriyaki; Instead of a small slice of salmon, they gave me a strip of salmon. They weren't cheap with it's portion cut and it was lightly glazed with teriyaki sauce. 

- Salmon Sashimi; Oh how I LOVE it raw and the freshness. How it melts in your mouth like butter and I LOVED how they weren't cheap with the cuts. They weren't thinly sliced like a few places would do. 

- Chicken Karaje; My sister, the poultry lover, loved this item and of course I had to try it too. Tender chicken pieces and carrots in a curry sauce layered on top of white rice and sprinkled with pickled tomatoe pieces. 

A great lunch date with my sister from beginning to end :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
Was at Japantown searching for a place to eat. The place is actually bigger than it seems. When I first peeked in it looked like there was only 5 tables. 
They share bathrooms with the restaurant next door. Theres only one men's and one women's. 
We got our teas and my friend wanted to have sugar in his tea so I asked the waitress when he was in the bathroom. I got a flat out "No." =/
C ordered the special with chicken teriyaki with california roll. Not a lot of chicken but I think my friend was pretty filled up. 
R ordered a pink lady. It was pretty good and big.
I ordered the miso ramen. The noodles were ehh and theres like no meat in it. 
I wasn't full so I ate off my two friends. =D
author: Sarah C.

description:
I consider myself to be quite a patient customer, although a bit picky with food taste. 

Tofu salad - plain salad with sloppily cut tofu cubes on top of it. It was pretty much a side salad with tofu on top, with poor presentation. Really?

Agedashi Tofu - they use very firm tofu and it ruined the dish. 

Poke - all I could taste was spicy. 

But this was what really irked me. I had also ordered the sashimi tacos. I thought it would be interested and wanted to try it. The server told us about 5 minutes after our 3 above appetizers had arrived that it would take a little longer. 25 minutes later, it still hadn't arrived. When I asked to cancel it, the server tried to tell me that it was almost ready. They didn't charge me for it, but we then had to ask 2 different people for the bill. Our server was busy chatting with coworkers eating meals toward the back. 

I cannot review the sushi or bento boxes that most people seemed to be eating, but appetizers were more than disappointing, and service was horrible.
author: Jane S.

description:
Good service, small restaurant, tiny (TINY) bathrooms, annoying gnats. 

Miso soup & Salad - Standard

Caterpillar Roll - Much better than the ones I get at home. The roll was topped with some fruity sauce (that was not unagi sauce listed by the menu) that gave it a wonderful spin. I'd order it again. 

Sake Clams (Asari no sakamushi) - Good if you like sake. I don't. 

Seaweed Salad - Standard

Seafood Teppan - Imagine a miniature plate of benihana's. It was good, and my mom especially liked the piece of fried fish egg they gave her. There were four types of seafood: two kinds of fish, salmon and cod (?), shrimp, and scallop. 

Grilled Squid (Ika Yaki?) - The menu says it takes 20 minutes to prepare; it took more like 10. While the glaze was good, it was cold and therefore the squid was a bit chewy. I'm looking forward to heating up the leftovers today hahah. 

Overall just an okay dinner in Japantown. I did enjoy the large menu, though.
author: Gina L.

description:
I will only be reviewing their Beef Curry Udon here because that is all I ever get here, I think they have one of the best Beef Curry Udon here in the city of San Francisco. The curry broth isn't too thick nor is it too watery (I've had places that water down the curry udon so much that you are literally just drinking brown colored water - not that appetizing now that I wrote it and read it out loud). The bowl is deliciously filled with potatoes, beef, carrots, fish cakes, udon noodles, and of course the curry broth. 

I would definitely come back again when I crave for some Beef Curry Udon!
author: Mona L.

description:
Long story short, come here at your own risk. Shady things can happen. Stand up for yourself. My group of 11 will never be back. My first ever negative experience. Details below.

Disclaimer: I'm not one of those people that bashes restaurants or one of those criminal types that treat places and staff poorly and then write them a bad review after. I straight up just enjoy good food and appreciate good people trying to do right by others. This post is long and charged because people I care about weren't treated honestly.

Anyone can check my other reviews. This is my first truly non-positive and longest review ever. I'm definitely none one that gives fewer bad atmosphere, loud patrons, broken tables, or even service time usually because I know that servers are so often overworked. I go strictly by quality and value of the food and the service rendered by restaurant staff. I could be sitting on a splintered wooden box next to a busy street and as long as the food is good and I don't get treated like an a**hole, I'll leave a generous tip, tell my friends, and bring them when I go back. But we just weren't treated with honesty and respect. If it had just been me, I might've let it slide. But it affected all of my friends and I just can't have that. I can't say that this wasn't just a unique experience to us since others have had okay experiences, but we said our thank yous after every single moment we were helped and demanded nothing extra and got this for it.

A large group of hungry friends and I stopped by Japantown for a meal before heading back inland after a long day. We always had fantastic experiences at the many restaurants here and thought it would be appropriate to treat our exhausted, bloody, bruised selves. They were the only place at the moment that could seat my group of 11 and acted very happy to be filling up their empty tables. They brought out some decent miso and water for us and even replaced my dropped chopsticks literally seconds after I dropped them and without being nearby. To this point, we felt pretty good about this place.

Then, not so much. We had split into two tables and while my other table had their orders taken promptly, I had to flag down a server after a cool and easy 10-15 minutes after they had passed us by multiple times, including to visit our other table that was further behind us. I didn't think it was on purpose, but poor service nonetheless. After that, we received our food which was mostly oyako dons, curries, and udon/soba soups which were actually spot on in taste and portion size. I had ordered a cherry blossom which had crunchy rice and fresh that clearly wasn't fresh but a friend's seaweed maki was decent. However the real kicker came afterwards, first one of my group had ordered a roll but was never served it and all of us had known it but thought nothing of it. When paying for his meal, however, he was still charged for it and despite mentioning it had never been served, the cashier insisted the restaurant was definitely correct and demanded payment. They argued back and forth and it wasn't until a few other friends were shaking their heads in disgust and talking about it that they relented. Then it came to my table, we had just been a part of this and hadn't been treated entirely well earlier either and were surprised to find that our group of 5 had been charged a gratuity that we felt was not appropriate. To my knowledge, gratuity is only applied for groups of 6, sometimes 8 or above and I can't recall seeing a sign for it in the front either. I asked them about it and they made no mention of their policy or anything but simply stated it was part of the bill and non-negotiable. I had wanted to make things right for my group, but we were all weary and wanting to return home and so we paid and ended up leaving with a bad taste in our mouths.
author: Charles M.

description:
I come here a lot with my family for a casual night out, and the waiters have seen us so many times that they already know what we're going to order. They're really nice and friendly, and they always have a smile on their faces.

My mom always gets the Yosenabe, which is a large soup with fish and mussels and vegetables. Over the past decade, she has never changed her order, and this dish has been consistently excellent. A lot of restaurants have been decreasing the amount of food they serve, but this is always a huge, very filling bowl of soup.

The Sukiyaki beef dish has also been consistent and very delicious. The meat is tender and tasty, with some onions on the side. The sauce goes very well with rice. I also like the combination platter, which gives you a bunch of options to choose from. I usually get a salmon teriyaki and tonkatsu, or a yaki niku (beef). It comes with rice and miso soup.

This restaurant is definitely good for a casual family dinner and has been a staple in my family.
author: KC W.

description:
In the mood for Japanese food on a Thursday night, we stopped in.  The wait wasn't bad considering it was right after Christmas and J-Town was packed.  I ordered a bento box with salmon teriyaki and katsu, and the lady ordered the katsu don with a 49er roll for us to share.  It was reasonably priced and the food was solid, but nothing spectacular.

The salmon I had was cooked well, but I thought the katsu was a bit dry.  The katsu in the katsu don, however was fine...  perhaps it was because of the egg that it was cooked with helped keep it moist?  The roll was decent- there was a good amount of fish on it, but we didn't like how the lemon/citrus flavor seemed to overpower the other flavors.  Not as many specialty rolls here as other places.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Uhhhh. Not impressed. 
For having such prime real estate inside the Japan Center complex, I would have expected much better quality. I've eaten at numerous of the restaurants in the "alleyway" they have in Japan Center, and tried this out last weekend. I wish I had stuck with the others, because while those prepare delicious homey Japanese food, Kushi Tsuru lacked in flavor, quality, and authenticity in my opinion. 
I ordered croquettes and gyoza, while my mom got a special with skewers, rice with pieces of raw fish, etc. and both of us didn't like what we were eating. My mom is Japanese and I've grown up on Japanese food and I've had much better almost everywhere else.
author: Azinda M.

description:
I've been coming to Kushi Tsuru for years and I am scolding myself for never writing a review until now. They definitely have one of the best udon noodle soups in the city, among other tasty menu items. The broth is perfectly salted and the noodles have that just-chewy-enough texture which I slurp right up. Best to enjoy while hot and fresh! I always order the Nabeyaki Udon since it has a little bit of everything to satisfy the indecisiveness in me. 

Other favorites of mine are the Hiyayakko (cold tofu with ginger and bonito flakes), Oyako Don, Salmon Skin Roll, Caterpillar Roll, and the Kushi Vine. It's great that they offer some vegetarian options since sushi isn't as healthy as most people think. 

I'm surprised this has some low ratings as I have always received friendly and attentive service, plus the prices aren't so bad either. Looking forward to eating here again!
author: Karen Y.

description: Slow service...and the food isn't authentic at all. The portion is big, but they may want to improve the recipes. I'm not a very picky customer, but this place does not meet my lowest standard.
author: Jasmine C.

description:
Six hundred and ninety two Japanese restaurants within a mile radius and I settle on this one? *sigh* Guess it wasn't my day.
I had some very salty tonkatsu with scrambled eggs over rice and scallions ($8), served up by Mrs. Oddjob, a surly dowager who looked like she could pick me up and throw me.
Oh and on top of it, the couple next to me decided to have their big "should we get married, or just have a baby instead?" conversation 10 inches away from me. AWKWARD
author: Lisa T.

description: Ughhhhh hate hate hate Japantown so much. There is seriously NOT ONE decent dining option. How can people stand this place?! I have no respect for anyone who actively chooses to hang out around here. Unfortunately my grandmother just moved in across the street and I can't exactly drag her across the city for some decent food so we always end up eating at some random pseudo over priced Japanese restaurant like Kushi Tsuru.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Our first time here and it won't be our last. We usually bring our stroller for our 1 year old son with us when we go to Japantown but we didn't on this visit. After trying 3 times to find a place that had high chairs we finally got a yes when we asked Kushi Tsuru. We were just hungry and didn't expect much from this place and it was the only place that would allow us to eat all at the same time. We also had our 6 year old daughter with us.

The service was top notch because of the attention to detail our waitress had. Our daughter doesn't like the veggies in the handrolls and everytime we order it somewhere else it always ends up with the veggies. Even though we say Salmon, tobiko, and rice only. Our waitress got it right! She also made sure we had extra bowls for the soup we ordered and dishes for our sushi. When she brought the hot food out she was really carefull and safely placed them out of reach from both of our children.

The food was really good to our surprise as well as pleasing to look at. We ordered a bowl of udon and had the Otoko Yama and Mango Paradise roll, two rolls that we have never seen anywhere else, and both were excellent. Our daughter had the combination shrimp tempura and chicken teriyaki chicken, she devoured it along with her salmon handroll (she's a picky eater). This was one trip to Japantown that we were glad that we didn't bring our stroller!
author: Mervin M.

description:
I would give this zero stars if possible. I have been going to this restaurant for more than 10 years ... it was a very special spot with unique bento boxes and always a treat for lunch or dinner. I took an out of town guest there yesterday and was so SHOCKED by the menu change (it is completely generic now) and more SHOCKED by the food quality and poor service. 

Since there were no unique bento boxes available, I ordered sushi rolls. One was spicy tuna. I don't expect much from spicy tuna, but this one was bland, tasteless and I actually sent it back. I have never sent sushi back in my entire life and I eat sushi probably once a week. The other roll (yellowtail) was also bland, like overcooked rice with no salt or seasoning -- even when dipped in wasabi and drenched in soy sauce (which I never do) it was somehow tasteless.

We waited until the end of our meal for a water refill. We had to walk to the front to bring our credit card, and then walk back again to retrieve it. I am sad for the restaurant that is gone, and hope the best for the new owners. If you cannot get spicy tuna right, I'm really not sure what options you have as that is truly the lowest common denominator for any sushi venue.

We found out the restaurant was under new ownership, which was obvious after the menu and one bit of the food. I feel bad, because the workers are obviously all new and trying to get their act together -- but at the same time, I have to be honest about my experience and hope they can change the menu, improve the food and improve the service.
author: Kelly G.

description:
There aren't many restaurants in Japantown that serve dinner at 9:15pm. Sadly, our favorite Maki was closed, so we ended up walking around until we ended up at a random restaurant (should of used Yelp, but I wasn't the one picking). 

We started off with a typical grilled squid and a fried fish - didn't expect much, ended up being ok. I ordered the ten don, just typical stuff you can find at Nijiya. 

Service is good though - I went to Sophie's before it closed and the servers were okay with us staying longer and enjoying the crepes inside.
author: Kevin L.

description:
We tried a couple of bento boxes. For 10usd it's an ok meal. No complaints at that price. It's not high quality but nothing horrible. My only complaint is that I had to clean the table myself that was clearly not wiped. 
Coming back over 30 years later to sf, I'm really impressed with this town.
author: Will S.

description: This place is horrible! We walked in at 4:45 and there was like 2 other table. It took the waitress 10 minutes to come take our order. 2 bento box, sashimi taco, gyoza and a California handroll. We sat there for  almost 20 minutes with no food. Then another waitress came and let us know they are out of sashimi taco. It takes you that long to find out you only have enough ingredient to make ONE taco??? It's not even busy and they can't handle the flow of business. This place is just bad with incompetent people working.
author: Jenny L.

description: I thought the sashimi here was pretty good and reasonably priced and I loved that it was in the mall where you could amble around and it genuinely reminded me of my trip to Japan that I had just taken a little over a month ago. Good place.
author: Mel G.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for a late lunch.  Seated promptly but the service wasn't too great.  Wouldn't say they were rude just super slow and not friendly at all.  

Food is eh.  Editable but not that great tasting.  

They were willing to split our tab for 8 people into 2 but added on the 18% gratuity.  For my side of the table's bill, we wanted to use 2 cards but the waiter didn't really know how to do that and everything was confused.  I think we ended up paying more tip than needed.

Will definitely not be back, especially with all the other fooding options around
author: Esther S.

description:
3 stars is definitely on point. 

This was the first place I tried in SF's Japantown and it was an okay experience. It's a pretty small place but the prices seemed pretty decent in comparison to some of the other restaurants in the area. I had the veggie udon and my bf had the California bento. The service was good and relatively quick =) The udon noodles here are pretty good, but the broth was just okay and some of the veggies were still a bit hard when I bit into them (too crunchy). My bf also mentioned that he wished his bento had more meat... but otherwise it was pretty good.
author: Sam F.

description: Went here again today. Super great food as always. Came with a larger group and ordered a variety of things. The udon was still top notch. I decided to order the spicy tuna tameki; I was tentative at first, expecting a nasty conglomerate sushi thing, but surprisingly it was great! I wasn't put off by the texture at all and it smelled delicious. The tuna don was great as well. Very satisfied with this place.
author: Aneesa I.

description:
Located inside Kintetsu Mall in the food alley, they are located in the premium high traffic area.  If I could choose any location in J-Town to start a restaurant, this area would be my top choice.  Ironically, all restaurants in this area (Benihana, Osakaya, Mifune, and Kushi Tsuru) serve below average Japanese food.  

While Kushi Tsuru is not a place to go for gourmet cuisine, I could see why people, especially tourists, would want to eat here.  The place has this fun feel of 1980ish Osaka's underground Sanbangai (a mall with hundreds of restaurants) with plastic displays of the food out in the front.  It is fun for people to take the time to study the displays and debate on which to enter.  

I want to tell them, 'Don't think too hard. They are ALL mediocre!'   

But I don't.  Besides, where else would I suggest?  Most of the good places are closed for lunch.  Seats at Maki (http://www.yelp.com/biz/-rQw0MruO0EDeTDWaCfNNQ) is very hard to come by.  Kuishinbo (http://www.yelp.com/biz/zj09K037XrZ_51Yh5qsIAw) has better food, but you have to deal with the mean lady and the atmosphere is not fun.    

WHAT TO EAT HERE:  Stick to their Kushi-Katsu, which is meat/seafood/veggi on a stick, breaded, and deep fried.  Doesn't sound healthy?  It's not.  However, it's very popular in Japan and there are some really good kushi-katsu shops in Osaka - some with standing room only.  Don't expect Osaka quality kushi-katsu here.
author: トモ T.

description:
Kushi Tsuru is a cookie-cutter quick-Japanese restaurant. They really don't do anything wrong, but there isn't anything that amazing about the place either. To be fair, this is Japan Town, and when I go to Japan Town I expect the best. I almost want to say, this place is the Yoshinoya of Japanese-American restaurants (people who have spent time in Japan, will understand the reference), but maybe a bit better then that. 
Everything is clean, and the Waitstaff are very polite.
author: Riley M.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5/5
Overall: 4/5

HANDS DOWN BEST Katsu Don I had ever had! Very flavorful! Their miso soup is a bit salty though :/ But besides that everything else is great! Tempura is great as well!
author: Eva H.

description:
Kushi Tsuru has a definite purpose for hungry people! If you like Japanese fried food, this is THE place! Kushi Tsuru does an excellent Kushi-Katsu, which translates to "deep fried food on a stick."

Six of us came here the other night with bottomless thirsts and insatiable pangs of hunger after meeting for drinks at our place at the Hotel Kabuki.
